How does a mobile application help a business automate the processing of orders and customer requests?Are you a business owner or top manager of a company? Tired of manually processing the flow of incoming calls, orders or requests in the company? Tired of the mistakes of managers and the ever-growing staff?Then the development of a mobile application for iOS and Android can greatly help in:‚úÖ¬†development of your business‚¨áÔ∏è reducing business costsüîÑ business process optimizationFor which companies is it relevant? Application development can help if:- Your business has a lot of orders or requests from customers- You have passenger or cargo transportation- Or you have rent of construction, transport equipment- You provide medical, telecommuting or fitness services- Do you service vehicles or equipment?- Renting out real estate- Provide courier or personal services to the publicWhat are the benefits of developing an application?- Savings on the work of line personnel (operators, managers, logisticians, etc.)- Decreased processing time for orders / requests / appeals- Reduce mistakes in order processing- Increasing business scalabilityHow do customers use such an application? A typical scenario for using such applications:- The client registers in the application- Places an order or request (fills in all the necessary data)- Tracks in-app progress with PUSH notifications- Can communicate with the responsible manager through the built-in chatHow do managers work with the application?- The manager receives a new request in his application or web panel- Starts processing the application- Carries out all the necessary procedures by the request- Specifies the necessary information from the client through the chat in the application- Upon completion of processing, can send the results to the application to the clientThus, the application helps to greatly simplify the interaction and communication with customers. Due to this, cost reduction and scaling of the company are achieved.Learn more about mobile app development on our website: https://whitetigersoft.ru#ios #android #business #management #mobileapps #mobileappdevelopment #businessapp #businessautomation

I've been working on this project for a long time. I came up with business solutions, analyzed data, and talked to real users. On this project I managed to get over my depression, hit rock bottom, and stopped believing in myself. I gave it up because I didn't find the strength to continue. I struggled with imposter syndrome, because there are so many cool designers around, coming up with different cool solutions! Who the hell am I?! My friends and the people closest to me believed in me. They encouraged and supported me. Their support helped me cope with the project and even made a presentation, which was especially difficult. But here, the project is here. Somewhere it's not perfect, and I know that. In any case, for me it is the event of a lifetime, because it is not just a picture, but a thoughtful and tested business solution that is ready to be developed and implemented and I can justify each of my design decisions in terms of the real environment.If you are a finance company, a startup or an enthusiastic programmer, then contact me to hire me or bring this project to code.Best wishes to all!#startup #design #business #project #designers #ux #productdesignd #ui

Hi all!This week I've been trying to work on the algorithmic script window. I standardized the program windows according to a certain template, where everything should fit, taking into account the convenience of functionality. The first stage took 4 iterations (photos below). It turned out to be difficult. Today I finished working on the Slippage window. Here's what I changed in the fifth iteration:- Removed the horizontal paginator and added a page number selector, which filled the empty space at the bottom right- In place of the removed paginator, I added an extra row of data to the table- Now when you click on a cell the numbers are brighter and the prompt to enter data appearswww.sashamake.design #productdesign #design #ui #ux #forex #trading #currency #forex #relocate #job #vero

Hi everyone!Today I did the last iteration and here's what I improved in the new version:- Paginator instead of a horizontal scroll bar. This is more convenient because you can see the number of pages ahead of time, and the toggle is not distracting and looks neat.- Slippage values color muted so that your eyes are less tired when browsing from the abundance of color.- Cells hover-effect added: the colors of Slippage values and the button for changing them are emphasized + cell outline stroke.- Column width and inside elements rearranged for a more convenient perception and harmonious look.- Two-line cell for "Unify column values".- 1 "Set" button instead 3 to remove visual noise. One button applies a value in all fields at once.- The space between the main table and the "Unify column values" takes up exactly one row of the table, for better visual harmonywww.sashamake.design #productdesign #design #ui #ux #forex #trading #currency #forex #relocate #job #vero

Hi there!Today I was developing a table for setting slippage values for trading instruments.These are the requirements for traders to view and edit this option:- present information in the form of a table, as this is a familiar way for traders to read information- the table must not be bulky and ideally should not prevent you from reading the information from the terminal, but at the same time it should contain all the necessary information- values should be edited for each trading instrument both together and separatelyIt is not an easy task. In my post I attach three iterations that I made to achieve these goals. I will be perfecting this window and will show the process for each iteration, so this is not the final solution.www.sashamake.design #productdesign #design #ui #ux #forex #trading #currency #forex #relocate #job #vero

So it took several weeks to decide on the right and needed kind of widget, and several years to survey and try.The requirements were that:‚Äî The widget should be small and not have a clutter of options‚Äî The choice of options should be logical, well thought-out and most importantly - demanded‚Äî Pictograms should be interpreted unambiguously, since any misunderstanding will lead to irritation and trading errors‚Äî Buttons must do what they say and showwww.sashamake.design#productdesign #design #ui #ux #forex #trading #currency #forex #relocate #job #vero

The design of this and other widgets and the terminal is based on the corridor surveys of professional traders with extensive trading experience and a clear understanding of their desires and the need for options. This fact distinguishes my work from the shots on Dribble and training cases on Behance, which often have nothing to do with reality.www.sashamake.design#productdesign #design #ui #ux #forex #trading #currency #forex #relocate #job #vero

I decided to make a short video of the animation and human interaction with the News widget. The opened widget has a fixed length with the ability to scroll with the mouse. The first paragraph from the preview is shaded in color to separate the already read fragment from the continuation of the news. The widget is closed with a cross or by clicking in any area outside the news.www.sashamake.design#productdesign #design #ui #ux #forex #trading #currency #forex #relocate #job #vero

Today I've been working on a news widget. It helps the operator to track and fast trade on news. The widget has a second timer to detect a news age, which is necessary to understand the relevance of events and also a link to the original source. Widget opens as drop-down to read the full text, and for ease of reading. The previously marked abstract is shaded to save a time while reading.www.sashamake.design#productdesign #design #ui #ux #forex #trading #currency #forex #relocate #job #vero

The Magora team took part in a new app development and helped the client‚Äôs tree flourish and bear fruit. A dynamic tree algorithm is at the heart of the InnovoCare application and was originally suggested by our client. We additionally used a MognoDB database, Node.js and Angular.js frameworks to achieve the high goals of the project. The InnovoCare app is designed to facilitate calculations of healthcare expenses along the entire path from diagnostic to recovery stage. Moreover, InnovoCare forms a well-organized library, providing the medical personnel with detailed reports that can be extracted if needed. Magora made the system dynamic with the possibility to track activity in real time. Flexibility and practical side of the app can serve as basis for future project in other spheres.Visit our blog and learn more: https://lnkd.in/e4YKTWHv#healthcare #development #medical #database #appdevelopment

That's a relief when delegating routine tasks to the automation system and freeing yourself for more crucial goals. This is just what Magora has developed for the client dealing with real estate management, and not just that. Using a created web application available through any browser, it was made possible to combine all data into an organised flow: all expenses are in check and every immovable object‚Äôs ROI is calculated. Based on the results of the market analysis, Magora added the function of price comparison to the market. Represented in a sleek design with visual examples of rental objects, the database is easy to deal with thanks to a thought-out structure and filters for quick search. Magora put strong emphasis on building app protection and worked in line with GDPR prescriptions. One of my sketches for customers on an amazing sole from the Italian company ALPI. The sole is called Commodo (article 2012). The sole is just super, it spreads in the metatarsals area (I don't know how the shoe makers call it in English, in Russian we call it puchki), if you haven't met this - take the time to go to their website and see.¬†I have a lot of work and worries and absolutely no time for social networks. I think it's good. I am very gratefull that I can work in my specialty, this is the most interesting job I know. I do both design and drawings, select materials, write accompanying passports, do graduation. I design components for shoes in 3D programs. This Friday I have my first exam in Turkish, I started to speak a little on it and it turned out to be very therapeutic. Another new foreign language gives you a feeling of regaining control over your life. Turkish is cool - a very mathematical, logical language, but completely different, not like English and Italian. I studied Italian for two years and even started speaking it at some point. Then the pandemic started and I didn't speak English or Italian for a year and a half. it turned out that it's not like a bicycle, unfortunately, the language sags if you don't speak it.¬† The good news is that it is very easy to restore! And the good news is that with each new foreign language, other languages are also experiencing a renaissance for some reason. At first, of course, on the contrary, but as soon as you stop constantly thinking about grammar and learning words - boom and you're a polyglot. And each new language is easier than the previous one. So my plan now is to speak Turkish in the fall (. Then Italian will automatically get better and I will go to LineaPelle 4-a lingual curious person without a home and a permanent job. this is my best plan so far. #design #work #job #learning #language #shoedesign #sneakers #sneakerdesign #alpi #elasticshoes

For those of you who know me or who have sat in one of my footwear design classes at NCSU, "sustainable" footwear has been on repeat in my messaging for over 20 years now. In fact my first attempts, although slightly misguided, were released in 2002 when I was director for Palladium footwear. In time I would go on to advance my understanding of the challenges of creating "sustainable" footwear, if in fact there is such a concept of sustainable mass consumption. Maybe we can only make footwear that has less impact? SO a few years back I started to take on what I saw as the area where the greatest gains could be made. To me it was the assembly process and eventually the disassembly process. Not just Circular manufacturing but low Co2 Circular. It was sort of a pipe dream because neither the chemistry nor infrastructure were in place at the time and to some degree still aren't. Recently Nike just revealed their ISPA projects which I think are great advancement in this area and many other industry leaders; Rothy's, Native, Salomon are working to this goal, sorry if I missed some of you.My goal was to create a Performance Based circular/simple assembly solution. I'll shut up now and let the video speak. It's a little fast, so feel free to pause or watch over and over. AND this is just the beginning have another exciting announcement coming soon. Contact me if you would like to hear more!  #sustainable #sustainabledesign #circulardesign #circular #footweardesign #sustainability

In a week I will be in Turkey for exactly 3 months. From the good - I got prettier, my usual white-green skin color of a Petersburger changed to golden, this is cool. I also started learning the language, went to Turkish courses. On the basis of what I learned myself before, it fits perfectly and I hope that by the middle of summer I will be able to speak it. I bought Chekhov's book the 6th ward in Turkish, sometimes I go to the theater to my new Turkish friends. I found friends here! - this is probably the best purchase. I have read a lot about the history of Istanbul and Turkey, I feel more involved in the context. Turkey is so similar to my country, we have so many intersections, a similar past and even the present (but not the same).I also make rubber boots - a new and interesting story for me, but I like what happens. As soon as I finish, I will share the result. From the bad - I work remotely, it seems I'm going to fail the university now, I don't have time for anything and - most importantly - I haven't found a job here yet. I really miss production, I love production so much, it's an important part of my work and my life. Production is life. No other sphere can compare. From the terrible - the war continues, which is being waged on behalf of my people, and I do not know how to fix it, there is no way. But over these 20 years, the people in Russia have really been deliberately stupefied. For example, beatings in the family were removed from criminal law. That is, domestic violence has become legalized. If violence against those closest to you is legalized in the country, what can be the relation to violence against others. I know that it is in my best interests not to talk or write about it, such topics scare off potential customers and employers. But I don't like to lie and I don't want to, I can't lie. Because of this, I left my country, having lost so much.  ( also my Facebook is now being read by the special services and I am being implemented here)#work #people #immigration #soledesign #shoedesign #sole #rubberboots #rhinoceros3d #rhino #rhino3d #design #Istanbul #stopwarinukraine #staywithukraine

Yesterday I posted a video, but I decided that I would not limit myself to this. I had to do a very simple job - 20 detailed sketches of heels on lasts of different heights. As a result, made 3D models on all of them, and also developed such a technology, the gel when forming the front part of the sole is mounted inside, it turns out a model that can be assembled even on a soft insole, without gluing any half-insole, because the foot support is already in the details of the bottom. Today, when I was three o'clock in the morning, I was sitting over another heel of incredible beauty (not this one, another one already) I thought this was my new booze. I do not know for whom I am doing this and what is the point of this and what is the future of this and what is the future of me, my loved ones. My friend from Kiev wrote a few weeks ago. ""What confuses me about the slogan "No to war"? maybe because it's the Russians who use it and it really means "Please, that would be like in 2014, when Crimea was annexed and everything was fine afterwards, they grumbled a little and nothing more." I don't even know what to say. What to write on your poster now. "Please forgive me for not dying on the 24th and earlier and still alive." This is true, we have already skipped the "no war" stage. After everything that the Russian Army has done in Ukraine, after the Butcha, there is no longer any "No war", it is no longer possible to cancel it, it is impossible to reconcile after all this, it is impossible to understand. I probably urgently need some more work, so as not to go crazy, I'm ready to hang a green "open to work" mask on my avatar. My God, these are my compatriots. For the most part, these are people from their small and very poor cities, but even in my city, people wear the letters Z - these fascist symbols. They watch propaganda and repeat it. My comrade wrote in the comments "I sincerely wish my country would burn in hell for this." Oh, dear, it's already burning, it's been burning in hell for a long time. And my beloved people are burning with her, my work, my industry, which is every day he is parting with the prospect of any shoes except military boots, my peers are burning, the brightest of whom are stuck on drugs, my university, my favorite city are burning, and not my favorite, too, and beautiful Baikal. I left because I had the opportunity - this is a functional family - Oleg and Marfa. If it hadn't been there, I wouldn't have left, of course, and I hope I would have been brave and consistent enough and would have already been in prison. Oleg supported me, it's not scary to take the craziest step with him. And Marfa - for her sake, it's not scary to decide on the craziest step. #notowar #ukrainerussia #soledesign #sole #life #slavaukraini #people #technology #work #job

The ‚Äúboniness‚Äù or slenderness of the foot can dictate the amount of ‚Äútwist‚Äù on the insole shapeDifferent foot shapes should be incorporated into the latest design ‚Äúlooks‚Äù‚Ä¢ Longer sizes may not have the ball girth required for customer fit and shoe shape may not becorrect for customers with wider feet‚Ä¢ Range of measurements noted: seven statistics that are important to fitting or last designing may require as many as 35 measurements.

Besides, I can't separate myself from my civic position. For the Russian professional community, it was like a red rag. My non-apolitical attitude was tolerated only because of my high competence and qualifications and ability to work. But now I realized that I don't want to be silent about it anymore and I urge all people in the world not to forget about their civic position - it's important for all of us, for the whole world. it is the wounded and the silence of the majority that gives birth to monsters. I have been and remain in opposition to the existing government in Russia for many years. They say that Russians support Putin and the War. This is not so, those who do not have their own opinion, who are used to agreeing and being apolitical, not thinking, simply agree with him. Unfortunately, yes, there are a lot of such people, but also there is a huge part of Russians who are now, despite incredible repression (to come out with a poster "no war" in Russia is now fraught with 15 years of real time in prison) participating in the protest movement. My friend works as a lawyer and human rights activist in an organization that helps political prisoners. After two months they have been working without leaving, so many people continue to struggle with the power of routine in Russia, although they understand that any protest now is a real term, loss of work, home, freedom and complete oblivion. It's actually suicide - but they keep fighting. I left Russia because I was also in the opposition, also opposed the war in Ukraine, against torture in prisons and the regime. To support political emigrants from Russia and to make the protest and people who oppose Putin more visible, I made portraits of respected and important people. These are political scientists, lawyers, political prisoners, activists, artists, journalists. some of them were forced to leave, some are in prison, some were killed by Putin's agents. I draw their portraits and print them on T-shirts and send them around the world. So far I've only baked yours. but there will be more. I have created a Telegram channel - it is one of the few social networks that can be used safely in Russia. There I lay out T-shirts and talk about the heroines. I can't always respond promptly to feedback and update content due to the huge amount of work. But I will be glad of support. In the photos - 1)Tamara Eidelman is a history teacher who ran a popular educational blog, she opposed the war in Ukraine, was forced to leave Russia, and was declared a "foreign agent". 2) Ekaterina Shulman - political scientist, publicist, popular presenter of political science programs, opposed Putin's policy, declared a "foreign agent". 3) Alexey Navalny, co-founder of the Anti-Corruption Foundation, lawyer, opposition politician, was poisoned by Putin's agents using Novichok, miraculously survived, is now in prison in Russia. #people #humanrights #power #support https://lnkd.in/dQ-ajetW - link for Telegram
A new sole for the project for the competition from #desma , #lacelessdesign and #footwearlogy

It was very interesting, even though I didn't have time to finish the upper and knitting. I took a flat scan from the shoelast, and prepared the shoe itself for the production of lasts in Istanbul. Maybe I'll finish it and make a great sample. I even wanted to make a scheme for knitting, because it was also my job, I opened a workshop for knitting the uppers of shoes in Moderam, three years ago. Oh, time, why are you running faster than me?? Thanks to this competition, I at least got to know a lot of shoe designers around the world, it's very valuable. and it helped me to distract myself from the daily panic in which a person finds himself in a situation when he is forced to flee his country and give up his whole life to escape from repression. Thank you guys for this opportunity. Even though I had to work seven days a week and forget about sleeping at night, combining it with work and study - I feel rested psychologically. This is much more important. #footwearlogy #lacelesschellenge #desma #rhino3d #rhinoceros3d #rhino #rhinoceros #design #shoedesign # #fashion #sole

I have already realized that the more thoughtful the sketch, the easier it will be when designing (engineering). I wanted to make hooks on the sole to fix the upper, but now I understand that I will finish this in Rhino already. In general, it's all such a luxury to do creative and do something besides orders for money. But if not now, then when. I refused all orders for the Russian army, it was good money, but on blood. I feel good mentally, physically scared - emigration does not provide for a stable situation. I guess I just really need a stable and long-term job. I'm not sure that it can be found on Linkedin in our business - I'm a designer and engineer of shoes, soles and accessories, I think it's good to look for a job here if, for example, you are engaged in sales or advertising. But on the other hand, I now have an image of the world professional community - God, how I missed it, it turns out!¬†Thanks to LinkedIn, I find out, for example, about the challenge from lacelessdesign, desma and footwearlogy. Yes, it's definitely inspiring. Sometimes I panic that because of emigration I will have to part with my favorite thing, so often it happens. only if you constantly do something, constantly work, study, work again - the panic recedes. It is difficult to live without the opportunity to dream about the future and plan something at least a week ahead. But this will be my personal challenge. #designer #business #work #engineering #lacelessdesign #lacelesschallenge

Life never gets tired of throwing you new tasks. I translated the manual for this great program into Russian, but now I've been trying for four hours to make the detail of the union form an accordion, because it's a natural moccasin. And in the heel, too, it was necessary to do so. And the part should be built not only on the upper surface of the pad. It seems that it's time to turn off the computer and take a step back to the analog methods of the designer's work.#designer #work #mind3D #mindCAD #moccasins #difficulttask

I want to tell you a little about what I do besides designing shoes and accessories. I am doing illustrations for our feminist organization, which is now actually conducting partisan activities in Russia. We are against war. Unfortunately, we do not need evidence of the atrocities of the Russian military, unfortunately, because we know exactly what they are capable of. We are working with the Committee against Torture, helping political prisoners, there are more of them every year, this is a very scary statistic. We were detained in Russia for peaceful protests - and we were subjected to violence at the police station every time - it was in peacetime with us - status white women, citizens of our country, in legal status, educated women with connections. And we have never been able to bring those policemen to justice. If they are capable of this in peacetime with "their" women, what will they do during the war with "strangers"? Now I have fled Russia because I have a daughter and I cannot risk her, but many of our organization have remained in Russia and continue to conduct guerrilla activities. One of the methods is the "Women in Black" campaign. This is such a sign "for our own" to know how many of us there are. We wear black clothes with white flowers, everything is completely in black.¬†This is a very beautiful action, sad and scary. We practiced this in Russia during the war in Chechnya, speaking out against the killing of civilians and violence against women. I really love black, for several years I have been dreaming of starting my own business, making my own small company and all the names are constantly revolving around black. My last name is Chernousova, "Blackmustaches", "Baffineri", if I were Italian. And I'm an anarchist, just like the King of Sweden. Black means a lot to me. Black and gray. I know that Linkedin is an opportunity to find a job, to establish professional contacts, this is not a political platform, but please - listen to me - I have lost my country because of this. Don't leave places "without politics", always be politicized, don't stop being citizens for a second, even when you are specialists, don't just be specialists. I am a good specialist who has lost the opportunity to work in her country, who has lost her country because of the apolitical nature of the people inside her. This is one of my illustrations just in time for the announcement of the Women in Black campaign.  #life #design #shoedesigner #blackbootssisters #black #womeninblack #war #warinukraine #antiwar #feminism #8marzo #againstwar #illustration #activism #women #blackboots

One propagandist on a Russian channel said in the first days of the war. when we began to take to the streets with a protest: "where have they been all these eight years? why were they sitting and silent? they didn't care!" this is a strange maxim, which was willingly picked up by my compatriots, who are afraid to think, to protest. it's scary to have an opinion and face the truth, but you have to justify your inaction with something. The annexation of Crimea took place eight years ago. For the record, I also opposed it, it was aggression, violation of the sovereignty of another country and a bunch, a bunch of lies and manipulation. But even if you were silent then, why can't you speak out now? I went to my Facebook page to take a look. what I wrote and what I did eight years ago. And I saw photos from the Admiralty Needle - this is a competition for young designers. I made a collection for him - I also made heels and pads myself. I made the heels first from architectural plasticine, then I made a silicone mold, and then I cast them from a special durable shockproof plastic, from which parts of headlights for cars are made.¬†My collection was called "Kimry is forever" and the models went to the music from Bond "Diamonds are Forever" - a series about Russia. Kimry is a city on the Volga, it has been the shoe city of Russia for centuries, the entire army of 1812 was shod there, there were several large shoe enterprises in the USSR, it was a beautiful, developed city. During Putin's rule, the Kimry turned into ruins. No army could destroy him the way Putin's government did - by theft, corruption, police violence, poverty. Eight years ago I was in Kimry, where I was collecting material for my collection. Eight years ago, I opposed the annexation of Crimea. Eight years ago, I participated in a competition of young designers with my collection and made heels for her by hand. #designers #shoes #shoedesign #Kimry #8yearsago

I'm sorry for so much personal in this social network, but I'm an open person (I need to write this in my CV)I have been in Istanbul for five weeks, working and studying all the time, it helps to cope with constant anxiety. ¬†Most of all now I need to find a job here in Istanbul, but one that I can fully put myself into it, as I know how, so that it becomes my new point of strength, support. You know that there has been a right turn in my country. I have been involved in civic initiatives for many years - that's the answer to why I never mastered snowboarding - I participated in feminist, anti-war movements, in helping political prisoners and believed, hoped for improvements. but the people around became more and more indifferent, the propaganda became more and more harsh and brazen. I remember how my mother-in-law turned off the TV 8 years ago during the news and took him to the dacha where she did not catch a signal to watch old video cassettes with Fellini's filmography on it - the best solution for preserving the brain, what a good fellow she is. But most people have been watching TV all this time and I am so afraid to communicate with my compatriots, with those who have stayed in Russia, I want to cry from the inability to help both those who understand everything and those who do not understand. Now there is a protest movement left in Russia - these are surprisingly brave people. Our friend was put in jail for an anti-war leaflet, which she left in the store - there was a court yesterday. She will receive 5-10 years of strict redim for an anti-war leaflet. She is an artist, a designer. an amazingly beautiful St. Petersburg girl. Her name is Sasha Skochilenko. The white-blue-white flag has become a symbol of protest in Russia. They say that it was the flag of the Novgorod Republic - the first democratic state on the territory of Russia. Veliky Novgorod is located not far from my hometown, in the north-West of Russia. I wonder if someday this will actually become my flag? I like this concept. In any case, it will all be a very long time, and now I really need a job in Istanbul. I built a sole for moccasins in a revolutionary color scheme for some time. #designer #video #like #job #artist #help #rhino3d #rhinoceros #rhino #soledesign #shoedesign #footweardesign #sole #footwear #moccasinc #project #freedom #whitebluewhite
If you want beautiful, do it beautifully

My friends organized a charity auction in Tbilisi  and I was able to participate in it.These sneakers were designed by me three years ago, and I made this fabric even earlier, almost five years ago - I was working then in a company that bought the first machine in Russia for knitting shoe tops. I mastered the program and made myself such coupons as a keepsake.The polyester threads from which these coupons were knitted are from Belarus, and the glue thread that makes the material so durable is from China, to which I also sincerely wish freedom. Then, in another place of work, I made the crosses themselves. All the fittings on these crosses and - most importantly - the soles are made in Ukraine. Loops - ArtSTEP company, which is located in Odessa. Soles is a JB company - an enterprise in Zaporozhye. That's how we worked here. Ukraine has always had the strongest shoe designers, the best productions on the territory of the so-called slavicworld. This war  knocked the ground out from under my feet, nothing will happen, how will I be able to live and work further, with whom. I left Russia and couldn't stay, not out of nobility, but on the contrary - out of fear of the darkness for myself and my family, I don't understand how to stay, unfortunately. These sneakers that I made specifically for the Femme-merch project in Eva's Ribs (fem-location in my city) I am transmitting from my beloved poor Petersburg to Tbilisi, while being in Istanbul myself. It was feminists who became the driving force of anti-war resistance in Russia - so wear these sneakers with pride. And it is in Ukraine that the sole on them and all the accessories are made - wear these sneakers with love. (on the side on the sole, according to my sketch and my request, the guys then put the coordinates of our factory in St. Petersburg, where we sewed them)#designers #work #project #project #help #sneakers #ArtSTEP #JB #Ukrainiansole #helpingtoleave #knit #PUhttps://lnkd.in/gMnBjds2  link to the auction

I built a shoelast for moccasins. I like the way our Italian partners did - there is no lingering insole at all, not even a half-insole. I struggled with the drawing, but everything worked out. The shoelast had to be without sharp edges, there was a adge in the nose and heel - especially for the convenience of shoelast production - there will be trunnions that are then cut off along the bottom, in order to properly trim the trunnions, clear edges of the bottom in the toe and heel are needed. Then it will be necessary to bring the abrasive to the template.¬†I really like the opportunity to make the pads myself and adjust them. Thanks to the company Ralf Ringer for the motivation to master Rhinoceros. I regret that I did not start working in it five years ago. Now, anywhere in the world, I just have to find a shoe factory and import my file into their program.

There are a lot of gray crows here - soon they will fly to my city, where my path is closed for now. in Germany, these crows are called "Russian crows", as I know. I made myself new business cards for my Istanbul life.#design #istanbul #fooweardesigner #businesscard

I left the country where Linkedin was banned for many years, as it refused to disclose data about its users. Previously, I had to access this social network via VPN or TOR, it was not so easy and even risky - there were precedents of criminal prosecution for using TOR in my country. But now for the first time I can use this network freely and I am very happy. I am a very open person and I lacked the feeling of a professional community. Especially for the last two years I have felt isolated from anti-covid measures. Now I left Russia fearing reprisals against myself - I participated in the anti-war movement. Now I hope that I will be able to stay in Istanbul and find a job here. It's a beautiful city, it's always been on my list of favorite places in the world, overtaking even Rome. Maybe here I can finally realize my dreams and plans, my achievements, my ideas, and benefit this city. I will be grateful for your understanding, support and suggestions. I will post here more often and talk about what I'm doing. In the photo, I am in the destroyed workshops of the Skorokhod production. This company was opened in my hometown in 1885, back in tsarist Russia. Then it actively functioned and grew throughout the history of the USSR. Over the past 20 years, it has irretrievably degraded and now, last summer it began to be demolished, blue fir trees were cut down, monuments in the courtyard were demolished in order to build another shopping center in its place. I loved him very much, I really love my unhappy city, my poor country, but I loved my daughter even more and to live in freedom, to create and work. #work #love #community #job #network #design #footwear #shoes #soles #productdesigner

At my last job, which I left six weeks ago, I recorded a final video about our new insole. Actually, it was not my idea, but the idea of our sales Director. But it is difficult for me to say no, except as part of the phrase "why not". In addition, it was originally a video for the sales Department, so that they would get a little into my eternal Christmas spirit about creating shoes. Then it turned out that I had to do everything myself and right now, he handed me his camera and ran off to practice. Well, I made this video, inventing the text as I went along. I wrote here that I will post this video here, but, to be honest, I was sooo ashamed, because this is basically not my job - I'd rather design and put into production several models. I'm still a little ashamed, but the scenes after the credits were fun and it really lifts the mood, so enjoy (after the ninth minute).#footwear #madeinrussia #sneakers #gruppomoron #insoles #shoes #shoeproduce

The situation in Russia is very difficult for the third week. I watch Euronews and I envy everyone except the Venezuelans. Especially I envy the Swedes! And I've been unemployed for three weeks. I wrote a statement at a time when no one in Russia could have imagined what is happening now. I wanted to prepare all the cases before leaving and I wrote a statement three weeks before leaving. And then, literally in the last two days of my work, the world around me began to collapse! Well, basically we are just pieces of an existential ocean and our whole life is just a wave that has washed up on the shore and it doesn't even matter what we leave behind. All this will be washed away by the next wave. I hope my ex-company gets out of this crisis, they are very cool and I am very grateful to them for everything. With their help, I made so many cool models and gained experience not only in developing models, but also in launching them into production. Experience is invaluable when you realize that now you probably can do everything related to the production of shoes.I publish photos of my favorite sneakers, we made a huge number of them for this summer, Petersburg will be shod! It was important to me, interesting, difficult and very cool.#shoes #sneakers #design #madeinrussia

I find the crucial metric in #startup development is "time-to-insight". Similar to time-to-market, but in #lean startup you don't even need to launch anything to market to validate the idea and get insights. So the faster you do it, the more advantage you have.The same principle is applicable to choosing product functions that you want to have in your #MVP. When I started developing okbob.app the initial specs were "Workflowy + Calendar". It seemed to be as simple as possible, but in reality, the first MVP could have been much lighter and we could have launched months earlier.TOP-3 features that we shouldn't have done in the beginning:1. Subtasks2. Drag-and-drop3. Demo for non logged inThe third one was an idea to show website visitors full functionality of the product without logging in ‚Äî and have an option to save data only after they log in. That implied storing all users' data in browser's local storage, and move it to database after login. That was a huge architectural undertaking and we had to abandon it to launch the product faster.Conclusion: give up as many unnecessary functions for your MVP as possible, keep the ones that provide maximum value to users and need minimum time to implement.

With first okbob.app users became active I want to share the vision of further product development.One of the reasons why I implemented a bot and command line from the beginning is that someday I want to add #AI to the product. An intelligent bot which will stand as a personal assistant and will help you to manage schedule and tasks in a smart way.A possible range of questions that it will be able to help with:üîπ How to arrange meetings more effectivelyüîπ What is preventing you to complete tasksüîπ How to maintain energy during the dayüîπ Negotiate on meeting time on your behalf via chatWhat else would you like to ask your personal AI-assistant?

I've been using #Workflowy for task management because it's light, easy-to-use and cross-platform. But it doesn't have calendar planning functionality, so I had to switch between task list and calendar apps all the time.Also, I use Telegram as my primary business communication tool. When I'd agree on meeting via chat I had to switch to another app to schedule the event, again.These are two reasons why I launched http://okbob.app: a web app with simple task list and calendar and integrated Telegram bot.If your experience is close to mine, give it a try, and I'd be happy to receive your feedback!

Four ways to add tasks in http://okbob.app ‚Äî choose the one that is easier at the moment:‚Äî from day's timeline‚Äî in the task list as in a text editor‚Äî from command line on the top‚Äî via Telegram bot#taskmanagement #planningapplication

Guys, I'm inviting you to try my new product's #MVP.It's a task list, calendar and day schedule managing web app.üëâ http://okbob.app/It's a very raw version in terms of interface, nevertheless I've been using it as my primary scheduling and task management app for around a month.You may also love it (despite the bugs and ugly visuals üòÖ) if:‚úÖ You use Telegram as your main messaging app for business (Telegram is also used for login to app)‚úÖ Most of the time you work from your desktop or laptop computer‚úÖ You use two different apps for calendar/schedule and task list and you are tired of switching between themI'm looking for any feedback about the app and would appreciate if you try it and drop me a line about your user experience here or in our Telegram support chat ‚Üí https://lnkd.in/gc2DNcSX#taskmanagement #planningapplication

A couple of years ago I was magnified by #nocode ‚Äî a way of creating digital products without programming. For me as for a programmer it was an easier way to go the full path from an idea to the final product: including design, backend, frontend and release.We built our corporate website on Webflow, tried to do some internal automation on Bubble, I created a telegram bot with Integromat (now Make).But when you scale, you need more control of your development process. Nocode is great for launching #MVP-s, prototypes, to test business ideas with basic features. But at some point you realise that the platform has restrictions that limit your freedom to develop the product precisely according to your vision.We also came to that point and most of the products we do the "classic" way with backend and frontend programming, figma design, devops on our own servers. For my new task management web app we use our team's beloved #javascript stack: Node, Vue, Nuxt.BTW I know and admire those entrepreneurs who managed to launch and even raise venture money with products made on nocode.Did you try to launch something on nocode?

It's now been 20 years that I'm dealing with task management in a professional way. The first project that I implemented as a teenager was a local network web portal in my neighbourhood. It included forum, classifieds, even torrent file exchange service (kind of) ‚Äî and that was the first time I had to plan my work and set goals.‚úÖ For the last 10 years I've been managing projects, teams and businesses. During this time I've tried many task management and project management tools. And while I found a good fit for managing my teams, I'm still not satisfied with my personal task management apps.On the other side, I've always wanted to launch my own product. My teams and I were creating products and value for our customers. And I lack that feeling that I had 20 years ago, when I created a product following my own vision and influencing many users' lives.ü§ñ These two reasons combined led me to launch a pet project ‚Äî a task management tool that I develop to make every day work better for me and for many others, I hope. Now as a product owner with a team on my side, but with the same passion I had as a teenager.I want to share with you, because I need to have a direct feedback to adapt the product for users needs.üí¨ If you feel the same frustration with the task management tools that you use as I do, please leave a comment ‚Äî it could be that our tool will solve your problems too.For now ‚Äî a sneak peak to what we have in the speeded up video attached.#taskmanagement #mvp #productivity #calendar

I have more than 10 years experience of managing a distributed team. For the last 2 years, Ratio ‚Äì digital production company has functioned without a situated office ‚Äî and yet, since last year, we have maintained notoriety in the TOP-100 Russian web production companies.I'd like to share some experience on three main business processes that lead to remote team success:1. people management,2. cloud services infrastructure,3. corporate culture.I will be glad if this helps you in improving your company's functionality and always love if you're able to share your experience in return.#remote #distributedteam #wfh #remotework #corporateculture #peoplemanagement

Per the latest government updates, it has been confirmed that we will remain in #quarantine until mid-May at least. For me, life hasn‚Äôt drastically changed ‚Äî having #WFH for the last 2 years, my lifestyle is pretty much the same. We are allowed to leave our flats exclusively for grocery shopping. If you plan to use personal or public transport, you must receive a QR code online. We are not allowed go for walks but are free to leave the city by car.Delivery services are overloaded ‚Äî grocery deliveries must be booked a week in advance, but locally-cooked meals can be delivered warm. My fitness coach conducts online training 6 times a week, keeping me in shape.My team at Ratio ‚Äì digital production company is proving to be more productive and motivated than ever as a result of the economy in crisis. In just two weeks, we've launched a #consulting practice, as well as a new product that we are planning to take global soon. The exchange rate of the Rouble has dropped due to the pandemic and subsequent falling oil prices, encouraging us further to seek out clients abroad. If you need #webdevelopment services or #remotework consulting ‚Äî seek out Ratio, where we are always ready for the job.While we may be far apart, we are all in this together.How is quarantine going in your city?

I recorded my first online-course about remote office management in 2015. Yet, at that time we had an office in Moscow with in-person management. Since then, Ratio ‚Äì digital production company has undergone essential changes, allowing us to operate as a fully distributed team of 20+ people for the last two years. Our remote success is demonstrated by a cohesive and complete work from home team that stands among the TOP-100 Russian Digital Production Firms.If you are used to working in an office setting, it's not going to be easy to adopt a new working reality. I am posting an adapted translation of my article that I wrote for the beginning of quarantine in Russia. Simple recommendations are here to help your company to preserve the team spirit and maintain productivity during these hard times.Please don't hesitate to ask me for additional advice if you have any issues with transferring to a remote team mode. I am always eager to help.#remote #remoteteam #distributedteam #remotework #wfh

Top 5 insights from #WebSummit last week:1) There should be a philosopher in every major tech company‚Äôs board of directors.2) Nigeria and Russia are among the 10 countries with the highest internet users worldwide: https://lnkd.in/d-H2d2V3) Regulators will be more strict with tech companies on users‚Äô data management. Going forward, less data will be stored on the companies‚Äô side.4) Tech addiction involves the same biological mechanism as drug and alcohol addictions, but you can‚Äôt control your smartphone usage in the same way.5) The new Microsoft Edge browser on Chromium base will have IE 11 compatibility!

Companies use a variety of mechanisms to gain customers‚Äô loyalty. One of the most renowned and effective retention strategies is providing a top-class service, which is what Ratio ‚Äì digital production company proudly supplies for its b2b segment. In b2c, traditional loyalty programs most commonly leverage discounts and bonus points, along with employing standard referral programs.A client requested we assist in finding a way to generate user acquisition while rewarding customers for promoting business that is feasible in today‚Äôs digital world.We came up with a social-based loyalty system that directly rewards clients for creating social media posts with hashtags or a link to the company‚Äôs profile ‚Äì the script parses the posts and gives bonuses to the user. These bonuses can be redeemed for complimentary or discounted company services. The more likes üëç and social interactions that the post generates, the more rewards the user receives.#loyaltyprograms #b2c #rewardsprogram #retention #socialmedia

Preparing for the Web Summit next week: I will be publishing some digital startup-related posts detailing my experience in the field. I will be in Lisbon Nov 5-9 and would be thrilled to meet you in person. If you are interested, please pm me :)Here‚Äôs one story of how data visualization helps to make business decisions.The important thing to understand about business schools is that you can‚Äôt learn in class how to do business. When we acquired our masters degrees in EAE Business School, my classmate, Ziga Novak, opened up a store to sell electric scooters. Unfortunately, sales did not achieve the anticipated numbers.Today, we use data analysis to help our clients make better decisions to locate their selling points and make effective predictions: use this real-life example of a project we worked on with our respected client operating within the beauty industry who was planning to launch a salon in Manhattan. The collected data of competing establishments and relevant customer segments is aggregated and visualized on a map that provides effective insight into the best customer flow.#websummit2019 #datavisualisation #startup #mvp #digital

Imagine that there is a place on the Internet that is very important for business, but you cannot use it from someone else's territory, not because there is a Firewall or other blocking technology. I ran into this situation today - I couldn't use one government resource using Google Chrome. The resource is https://lnkd.in/e3Hy3qqc - perosnal page of individual entrepreneur in tax department. Try to open it with any modern popular browser (Chrome, Firefox, Edge) and you won't be able to open it. The reason is that this resource uses a special protocol TLS (for HTTPS connection), which uses a special "GOST" (national standard in Russia) cryptographic algorithm. In addition, it uses a special certificate signed by the Ministry of Communications of the Russian Federation. So how you can open it? Two actual variants:1) Use Russian browser, like Yandex.Browser, because it support this TLS GOST connection2) Use special "Chromiun Gost" that also supports this type of connection.But in addition to that, you should have special cryptographic software installed in your system. So I think this is quite an interesting example of what we will have in the future of the Internet as an example of deglobalization and disconnection between countries without hardware disconnection of cables#technology #software #future

I have a question for my firends as well as their connections (all welcome in the comments). Please explain to me what is the key difference between the #Metaverse and the #Internet that we used for years. Why are some people so obsessed with it and why shouldn't what we have now be called "Metaverse"? Let me decribe what I mean with words "we have now" (at least in #Russia) :We can find a job online, even on social networks, even here - on LinkedIn.Today, all interviews can be done online. Imagine, before I got hired at UiPath, I went through about 7 interviews with different people all over the world. Without any offline meetings. Each time I was in the same room with the same laptop.All job can be done online. It was true for Freelance many years ago and actual for most of jobs, linked to IT from 2020. When I was employed in UiPath, we met with colleagues 1 time per quarter, just to discuss something in real and celebrate our good numbers.Entertainment - starting from watching movies, listening to music, we can also spend time in MMO games. I was doing this even when I was a student in 2008. We met up with real-life friends, had fun, had serious discussions, even solved issues with university staff in MMOs. Even finding my love - It's a funny story, but on April 1, 2017, Facebook on a tip decided to add a girl unknown to me as a friend. When I did - she liked all my pictures, which prompted me to start chatting with her. After 1 month we met in real life, after 2 months we started living together in the same apartment, after 1 year and 4 months we got married. And yes, we sent our marriage registration application online.Now we are living in our own apartment, which we found on the Internet, got a mortgage on the Internet, entered into a contract to buy this apartment on the Internet.We buy food, water, clothes, and some other things online. That is literally what I want to say - my whole life is connected to the Internet, it's my reality. And when I heard about the Metaverse, that it would give literally the same things that I had been using for years - I was a little puzzled, so what's the magical point, why are so many people going crazy about the Metaverse? I may be missing something, so I'd be glad if someone could open my eyes.PS: This is an old picture of me from my university days, edited by friends about 6 years ago. It's a little funny, but I think it's my best picture that I can relate to the Metaverse topic.

Wow! Very interesting email I just received from very trusted source. #Windows era is about to end. #Microsoft take sponsorship of #Uninstall Windows, MSSQL and replace it with Russian solutions.Yes, it looks like clickbait header, and original action of ms is little bit different, but real impact is that what you can read in header. What's happen? Microsoft not prolonging SPLA¬†contract, it means that from September 1st all users of #YandexCloud cannot use Microsoft products. In Email from Yandex they say that every consumer should take care about moving from Microsoft products (Windows, SQL Server, Remote Desktop Services) to other platforms (obviously to #linux). Actually in big russian companies we already have success stories of moving Windows to trash bin, but it was rare, because Russian operating systems, rdbms and other tools not so costly as Microsoft ones, and partners can't feel big profit when selling it. But if we will have more installations, more success stories - it could be a tipping point. Ok, what's bad for Microsoft in this case? Probably that earlier or later sanctions will gone, but big Russian market will be lost. And more - Russian vendors will have great ability of replace Windows, that could be done in other countries around the world. So thats why I think that this action of M could be the end of Windows era. PS: I love Microsoft from my childhood. I remember my feelings when I was 5 years old, my father updated PC in our home and installed Windows 3.1 - it was something crazy after DOS+NC experience. I loved Microsoft company because they spread technologies all around the globe, I loved conception "PC/Windows in every house". But finally something go wrong and Microsoft forgot own big idea and now removing Windows from big country by own hands. That's sad. I deeply hope that someone clever in this great company will cancel this decision and will go back to big Russian market before it's too late.

I have a hobbie - investigating connections between cultures that was hidden in 100+, 1000+ years ago. Something like "Why do we have different variants of the names, for example: John, Jochen, Ioan, Ivan - it is actualy same name in different cultures". But there was one question that blowed my mind - "Why do we lose some letters or they totally changed pronouncing". Let see to this letter - œâ - it is "Omega"... But most of modern people (who don't know "Omega") will say that it is "Stylish W/double-u". Probably somewhere in public resources we have an answer for that, but looking to our days and seeing what's happening to the letter "Z" now, I think that there could be other reasons. What's wrong with letter "Z"? I love this letter, most cool things use that, some festivals have this letter, even we have "Generation Z" now. But after February 24 this letter is "Banned" in most of the places. Why? Just because some Russian guy in Russian army decided to mark tanks, that will act on the WEST front with this letter. Why Z? Because in Russian language word "WEST" translating as "–ó–∞–ø–∞–¥", and if you will just transcript it (not translate) to english, you will have: "Zapad". They used first letter - Z from Zapad (west). That's simple, and nothing more. There is no special symbolism or something magical. But now I'm afraid to show my passport cover to my western colleagues, because I have big letter "Z" on it (Because it is symbol from "Zelda" game).And who knows, maybe after current situation, people after 100 years will not use letter "Z" as we use it.#people #language #letters #z #russianarmy

This week I had the chance to evangelize the #ArtOfThePossible during #UiPathTogether Amsterdam and I would like to share with you what our customers & partners experienced at our #ImmersionLabs booth.To begin with, attendees had the option to play at our 'Self-playing stations' where they could experiment the daily activity of a Claims Officer, IT Helpdesk Technician, Medical Receptionist, Loan Officer, Revenue Cycle Manager or Anti-Money Laundering Analyst, everything in a very interactive fashion. Those industry-tailored demos were accompanied by a synthetic actor from #Synthesia that would explain what the #UiPath Robot is doing at each step, guiding the user in discovering the power of #automation and value proposition behind each showcase.On the other side, we had prepared 'on-demand' showcases with industry specific scenarios,  carefully selected and discussed with our Industry Leads (big kudos to Peter Villeroy, Elaine Mannix, Keelan Singh, David Burrows, Sebastian Seutter, Tino V. and everyone who contributed to this). We had demos covering, among others, Healthcare, IT Ops, Banking, Insurance, Manufacturing, Telco, Contact Center and Retail. We also had technology-driven showcases on hot topics such as AI/ML, Document Understanding, Voice Chatbots and Integrations.I am grateful because I had the chance to connect with a lot of customers, partners and UiPathers from all-around the globe. It was so energizing to see that our content was relevant to them from a technology and/or business point of view.Also, having some networking after this difficult pandemic is something that I really enjoyed. I finally got the chance to meet Boris Krumrey in person!Finally, I would like to give a big kudos to my colleagues that contributed a lot in engineering & testing the RPA parts, creating the video/presentation content and all the other dependencies: Shweta Tiwari, Vinit Patil, Andrei Hruscovschi, Abdullah HAYIRLI, Valentin Drazdov, Vlad CioboatƒÉ, Ilya Kochetov, Nariender Mishra, Dr. Nikolai S. Kabanov,  Kristina Virolainen and Alexandru Crijman, the mastermind behind this beautiful story.A big 'thank you' goes as well to my colleagues on site that helped me deliver the content at the best possible quality: Doinita Danuta (Doina), Claudia Pedersen and Gabriel Sidor.

Very first thing that you will probably like to do in every fresh Windows 11 installations - is to cancel new design of Explorer menu and get back good old Ribbons. Here is short instruction how to do that:1) Open regedit (you can do it with Start menu)2) Use path field to reach: "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Shell Extensions\"3) Right click to "Shell Extensions" in tree, select submenu "New", select "Key", name it "Blocked"4) Right click to "Blocked" in tree, select submenu "New", select "String Value", name it "{e2bf9676-5f8f-435c-97eb-11607a5bedf7}"5) Restart your Windows session (Sign out, Sign in, or just restart PC)6) Enjoy ribbons#windows11 #explorer #microsoft #software #design

What is a major difference between niche player on the IT market and global leader? I know one universal measure to find if IT company gonna be real big - support of free/community version of the product. You can find very great product from some IT company, but will you interested in this if you will must to write to sales manager, send him some information about your company just to have ability to test it in your hands? Little interesting fact about me at this Friday. In my childhood I had russian book with tale "I was in the computer city" about boy who came into PC and had a lot of adventures. But the most important part of this book was in the end - "Professor Fortran's encyclopedia" (also was released separately).  Originally it was comics about  Professor Fortran's funny pets who wants to know everything about PC. On this stripe cat (who was most smartest in the team) helped to caterpillar with her request "We need to sum 2 and 3. Please, write program for us". Cat done that with Basic and made advice to readers: "Guys, learn how to program!".I was about 4 years when my brother helped me to read that book but we already had Intel80286 PC in our house with preinstalled BASIC. So I just manually rewrite code from this stripe to BASIC and it worked! I was very surprised, changed some numbers and was wonder how this magic happens. So in that moment I defined that I want to connect my life with IT world. PS: I was wonder now that this book was not translated to English! (Or I Just can't find that). Probably I will take care about translation...#fridayfun #interestingfacts #basic #intel80286 #retro

About 10 years ago, I was at a crossroads - I had the same chances to become a system administrator or software developer (for business applications). I saw that because of the large number of standards that were implemented in the world of system administration - it became more boring and lost some romance. Since software development still had an element of "chaos" and there was room for unconventional thinking - I chose the path of a software developer.Now I see that the same thing is starting to happen with business application development-in the future, we will have more standards, less coding, which means less romance, but more quality.Since many of my friends dream of becoming business logic programmers, I think I should tell them about the thoughts that will come to our reality very quickly.#it #thoughts #future #ai #robotics #bpm #automation

Silicon Valley BankHow to destroy one of the largest banks in the United States and put the entire startup industry at risk?2021. Startups receive significant investments and deposit them into SVB. The bank invests in US bonds at a differential rate, which is a reliable but low-yielding asset.2022. The bank faces challenges from both sides. Fewer new investments and deposits from startups. The key interest rate in the US is increasing, bonds that were purchased a year ago are losing value. The most reliable asset turns out to be not reliable enough.Now. The public disclosure of SVB's problems has led to a run on deposits and the bank's collapse, marking the second-largest bank failure in US history.Never put all your eggs in one basket. Even in such a big.‚Äî‚Äî#startups #investments #siliconvalleybank

Waiters Part 2What does the work of a waiter involve in interacting with guests?- Greeting guests and offering menus and drinks (1-2 minutes)- Taking orders and entering them into the POS System (5-10 minutes)- Serving dishes and clearing the table (5-10 minutes)- Attending to the table (during the entire lunch or dinner)- Preparing the bill and settling with guests (5-10 minutes)Thus, up to 22 minutes are spent on the processes of ordering and payment per table. What if this time could be reduced to 2 minutes? Restaurants typically operate from 12 to 15 hours a day. Assuming that guests spend an average of 1.5 hours in the restaurant, such a reduction in time will increase the number of seating by 20%.In combination with the previous calculations, reducing the number of waiters and automating the processes of taking orders and payment will increase the restaurant's revenue by 30-50%.What's the point of all this? Restaurants are not startups. They cannot live on investor money forever. Revenue and profit are important to them. The lack of balance between the growth of food costs, rent rates, and the purchasing power of the population leads to a decrease in attendance, turnover, and profit. Why "reinvent the wheel" and come up with new concepts that will only last for a few months, when you can elegantly solve this problem without compromising the quality of service?

Waiters Part 1Let's talk on the example of the market in Russia. There are about 2.5 million people working in the restaurant industry in Russia, of which around 600,000 are waiters. This means that waiters make up approximately 24% of the workforce. Their average salary in Russia is around 40,000 rubles per month. Taking this figure into account, it can be estimated that restaurants' total labor costs for waiters can reach 34 billion rubles per year (including taxes and contributions).According to a McKinsey study, the use of technology to simplify service processes can reduce the number of waiters by 30-50%. This means that restaurants can save up to 17 billion rubles per year on waiter wages. The implementation of such technologies will help to speed up service, accommodate more guests, increase their satisfaction level, and the likelihood of repeat visits. With an average restaurant revenue of 2.2 million rubles per month, a reduction in the number of waiters can lead to an increase in revenue of 10-20%.There is, of course, a reverse effect, where a waiter can "sell." However, this only works well for the expensive restaurant segment, which accounts for no more than 1% of the total. If we still assume that "selling" waiters exist everywhere, the effect will still be minimal. The percentage of guests using waiter services when choosing dishes does not exceed 20% according to statistics. If we assume that every third "sale" will be successful and that the average check will increase by 50%, the overall effect will not exceed 2% of revenue.Thus, waiters can bring the restaurant an additional 2% of revenue, while their reduction can increase it by 20%.Henry Ford introduced the assembly line in 1913, which increased labor productivity by 8 times and allowed for a reduction in car prices, making them accessible to a wider range of consumers, which in turn led to a significant increase in the company's profits and the overall growth of the automobile industry in the United States. One person, one idea, but what an impact!Process automation is not a panacea, but it can be a push towards industry development.

Last week I heard from my colleagues good term "edutainment", which I think perfectly describes the current approach to education by many :) Trainings not as an instrument of receiving new knowledge but as a race for the certificates, medals, badges etc. I think this leads to a reduction of the quality of the learning information, you get a fastfood but not real learning. I do not call on those who do this to give up edutaining, you have fun it's good. However, colleagues, who are the managers, how do you solve the problem to make your teams learn but not "edutaining"?

Eng version bellow ‚§µ–ó–∞–º–µ—Ç–∏–ª —Ç–∞–∫—É—é –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∏ –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫–µ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã: —á–µ–º —Å–µ—Ä—å—ë–∑–Ω–µ–µ –Ω–∞–º–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏, —Ç–µ–º —Ä–µ–∂–µ –æ–Ω–∞ –∑–∞–¥—É–º—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø—Ä–æ –≤—Å—è–∫–∏–µ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤—ã–µ.–û —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤—ã—Ö —á–∞—â–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç —Ç–µ, –∫—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –æ—Å–æ–±–æ —Å–µ—Ä—å—ë–∑–Ω–æ –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω—ã (–∏–≥–Ω–æ—Ä—è—Ç, –ø—Ä–æ–ø–∞–¥–∞—é—Ç –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–≥–æ –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—è, —Å–∏–¥—è—Ç —Å –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–æ–π –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏–µ–π –º–µ—Å—è—Ü–∞–º–∏ –∏ —Ç.–¥.). –≠—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–æ, –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ, –Ω–æ –≤—Å—ë –∂–µ –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ —è—Ä–∫–∞—è –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å.~ ~ ~ I noticed such a pattern when looking for a job: the more serious the company's intentions, the less often it talks about test tasks.Test tasks are most often spoken of by those who are not particularly serious (they ignore, disappear after the first communication, sit with an open position for months, etc.).This is not a rule, of course, but still a pretty clear pattern.#hr #ux #ui #productdesign #design #opentowork #job #communication #—ç–π—á–∞—Ä

Eng version bellow ‚§µ–í—á–µ—Ä–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–ª–µ—Ç–µ–ª –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ –∑–∞–±–∞–≤–Ω—ã–π –æ—Ç–∫–∞–∑ –ø–æ –≤–∞–∫–∞–Ω—Å–∏–∏ üëÄ –Ø –∏—â—É —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏—é UX, UI –¥–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω–µ—Ä–∞, –Ω–æ —Ç–∞–∫ –∫–∞–∫ —è –µ—â—ë –∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –∏–ª–ª—é—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä/—Ö—É–¥–æ–∂–Ω–∏–∫, —Ç–æ –æ—Ç–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª –æ—Ç–∫–ª–∏–∫ –∏ –Ω–∞ —Ç–∞–∫—É—é.–í–∞–∫–∞–Ω—Å–∏—è:—É–º–µ—Ç—å —Ä–∏—Å–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å(–∫–æ–º–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏—è, –ø–µ—Ä—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–∞, —Ç.–¥.), –∑–Ω–∞—Ç—å Photoshop –∏ –∏–º–µ—Ç—å –æ–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å –≤–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –≤ –Ω—ë–º. –Ø:—É–º–µ—é —Ä–∏—Å–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å (–∫–æ–º–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏—è, –ø–µ—Ä—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–∞, —Ç.–¥.), –∑–Ω–∞—é Photoshop –∏ –∏–º–µ—é –æ–ø—ã—Ç—å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å –≤–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –∏ –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –≤ –Ω—ë–º. *—Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–∏–ª*–û—Ç–∫–∞–∑:"–ò—â–µ–º —Ö—É–¥–æ–∂–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ —Å  –æ–ø—ã—Ç–æ–º –≤ –∫–∞–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–µ, —É–≤–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ–º —Ä–µ–Ω–¥–µ—Ä–∞ –∏ –≤–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –§–æ—Ç–æ—à–æ–ø–∞, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ —à–µ–π–ø–æ–≤."–ü–æ–ª—É—á–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è, –æ–Ω–∏ –∏—â—É—Ç –º–µ–Ω—è, –Ω–æ —è –Ω–µ –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–∂—É üëÄ P.S. –°–∫–æ—Ä–µ–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ —ç—Ç–æ –∫–æ–ø–∏–ø–∞—Å—Ç–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –æ–Ω–∏ —à–ª—é—Ç –≤—Å–µ–º, –Ω–æ –≤—Å—ë —Ä–∞–≤–Ω–æ –∑–∞–±–∞–≤–Ω–æ. ~ ~ ~Yesterday I got a rather funny job rejection üëÄI'm looking for a job as a UX, UI designer, but since I'm also a professional illustrator/artist, I applied for this one as well.Job requirements:Be able to draw (composition, perspective, etc.), know Photoshop and have experience with vector in it. I am:Able to draw (composition, perspective, etc.), know Photoshop and have experience with vector and not only in it.  *links attached*Rejection:We are looking for artists with experience in casual graphics, a confident level of rendering and vector tools in Photoshop, as well as the use of shapes.It turns out that they are looking for me, but I don't fit üëÄP.S. Most likely this is a copy-paste that they send to everyone, but still funny.

Eng version bellow ‚§µ–ö–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–æ –æ –º–∞–ª–µ–Ω—å–∫–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–∞—Ö:–Ø –Ω–∏–∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É—é –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ "—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤–æ–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ" (—Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ "—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∞—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞"). ü§î –ü–æ—á–µ–º—É?  –í—Å—ë –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ: –∫–∞–∂–¥–∞—è —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∞ –∏ —Å–ª–æ–≤–æ –∏–º–µ–µ—Ç –∞—Å—Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π —Ä—è–¥ –∏ –º–Ω–µ —Ö–æ—á–µ—Ç—Å—è –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç—å –∞—Å—Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –ø–æ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–æ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —á–∞—Å—Ç–µ–Ω—å–∫–æ –ª—é–±—è—Ç –æ–±–µ—Å—Ü–µ–Ω–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ç—Ä—É–¥ —Å–æ–∏—Å–∫–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è.  –°–ª–æ–≤–æ "–∑–∞–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ" –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∫–ª–∏–∫–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å –¥–æ–º–∞—à–Ω–∏–º –∑–∞–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –≤ —à–∫–æ–ª–µ. –ê –∑–∞ –¥–æ–º–∞—à–Ω–µ–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤–∞–º –Ω–∏–∫—Ç–æ –ø–ª–∞—Ç–∏—Ç—å –∏ –Ω–µ –¥–æ–ª–∂–µ–Ω ("—ç—Ç–æ –∂–µ –≤–∞–º –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ, –∞ –Ω–µ –º–Ω–µ!"). –õ—é–¥—è–º, —É–ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±–ª—è—é—â–∏—Ö —Ç–∞–∫—É—é —Å–ª–æ–≤–æ—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—É, —Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –≤ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤—É —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ, –∞ "—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞", –∏ –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–∞ –±—ã—Ç—å –æ–ø–ª–∞—á–∏–≤–∞–µ–º–æ–π, –∫–∞–∫ –∏ –ª—é–±–∞—è –¥—Ä—É–≥–∞—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞.  –ü–æ–º–Ω—é –µ—â—ë —É—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–∏—Ü—ã –õ–∏—Ç-—Ä—ã –≤ —à–∫–æ–ª–µ —Ü–∏—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª–∞ –Ω–∞–º (–≤—Ä–æ–¥–µ) –ö–∞—Ä–ª–∞ –ú–∞—Ä–∫—Å–∞: "–Ω–µ–æ–ø–ª–∞—á–∏–≤–∞–µ–º—ã–π —Ç—Ä—É–¥ –±–µ–∑–Ω—Ä–∞–≤—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–µ–Ω". –° —Ç–µ—Ö –ø–æ—Ä –∑–∞–ø–æ–º–Ω–∏–ª–æ—Å—å.  –†–∞–Ω—å—à–µ —è –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏–¥–∞–≤–∞–ª –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–µ —Ç–µ—Ä–º–∏–Ω–æ–≤, –Ω–æ —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å —è —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–ª —Å–µ–±–µ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø: –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å –≥–æ—Ä–¥–æ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ "—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∞—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞". –ú–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –≤—ã —Ç–æ–∂–µ –∑–∞—Ö–æ—Ç–∏—Ç–µ —Ç–∞–∫ –¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å ‚òÉÔ∏è–ë—É–¥—É –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä–µ–Ω –ª–∞–π–∫—É –∏–ª–∏ –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏—é ‚ù§Ô∏è~ ~ ~Briefly about the little principles:I never use the expression "test task" (only "test work").ü§î Why?  It's simple: every phrase and word has an associative array and I want to change the associations of potential employers, who often like to devalue the work of the applicant.  The word "task" has something in common with homework at school. And no one should pay you for your homework ("you need this, not me!"). It does not occur to people who use this word form that this is not a task, but a "work", and should be paid, like any other work (job).  Btw, I remember the literature teacher at school quoted to us (seems to be) Karl Marx: "unpaid work is immoral." I remember it since then.  Previously, I did not attach importance to the specifics of terms, but now I have created a principle for myself: to speak proudly only "test work". Eng version bellow ‚§µ–ü—Ä—è–º–æ —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–∂—É —Å—Ä–∞–∑—É –¥–≤–∞ –∫—É—Ä—Å–∞ –Ω–∞ Coursera –ø–æ UX –¥–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω—É: –æ—Ç University of Michigan –∏ –æ—Ç Google. –ü–æ–∫–∞ —á—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–æ 3 –Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –∏ –º–æ–≥—É –ø–∞—Ä—É —Å–ª–æ–≤ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å –æ –Ω–∏—Ö.–Ø –±–æ–ª–µ–µ-–º–µ–Ω–µ–µ –æ–ø—ã—Ç–Ω—ã–π –¥–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω–µ—Ä –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—Ñ–µ–π—Å–æ–≤, –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –æ–±–∞ –∫—É—Ä—Å–∞ –¥–ª—è –º–µ–Ω—è –ø–æ–∫–∞ —á—Ç–æ –≤ –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ –Ω–∞–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω—ã —É–∂–µ –∏–∑–≤–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ–π –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–µ–π (–æ–Ω–∏ —Ä–∞—Å—Å—á–∏—Ç–∞–Ω—ã –Ω–∞ —Å–æ–≤—Å–µ–º –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é—â–∏—Ö). –•–æ—Ç—å —è –∏ –≤–∑—è–ª—Å—è –∑–∞ –Ω–∏—Ö —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–≥–æ –∏–∑-–∑–∞ —Å–µ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ç–æ–≤, –Ω–æ –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–∞—è –∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–∞—è –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—è —Ç–∞–º —Ç–æ–∂–µ –µ—Å—Ç—å.–ö–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –≤ —Å—Ä–∞–≤–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–∏:   –í –ì—É–≥–ª–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–º –∫—É—Ä—Å–µ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å (–æ—á–µ–Ω—å!) –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –≤–æ–¥—ã –∏ —Å–ø–ª–æ—à–Ω–∞—è —Ç–µ–æ—Ä–∏—è —Å —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∞–º–∏. –ù–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –∏ –ø–ª—é—Å: –≤—Å—ë —Ä–∞–∑–±–∏—Ç–æ –Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–µ–Ω—å–∫–∏–µ –≤–∏–¥–µ–æ —Å —Å—Ç–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–º –≤–∏–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º –æ—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º, –∞ –≤ —Ç–µ–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –µ—Å—Ç—å –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω—ã–µ –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–∏–∫–∏.  –í –∫—É—Ä—Å–µ –ú–∏—á–∏–≥–∞–Ω—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏—Ç–µ—Ç–∞ —É–∂–µ –Ω–∞ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ –±—ã–ª–æ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ (–∏ —É–∂–µ –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ–µ). –¢—É—Ç –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä–æ–≤. –ü–æ—Ö–æ–∂–µ, —ç—Ç–æ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ–≤–µ—Å–Ω—ã–π –∫—É—Ä—Å.üéÑ–ï—Å–ª–∏ —ç—Ç–∞ –∏–Ω—Ñ–∞ –≤–∞–º –±—ã–ª–∞ –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–∞, –±—É–¥—É –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä–µ–Ω –ª–∞–π–∫—É –∏–ª–∏ –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏—é –ø–æ —Ç–µ–º–µ (–Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, –∫–∞–∫–∏–µ –∫—É—Ä—Å—ã –≤—ã –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∏–ª–∏ –∏–ª–∏ —á—Ç–æ –¥—É–º–∞–µ—Ç–µ –æ —Å–µ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ç–∞—Ö) üêØ~ ~ ~Right now I am taking two courses on UX design on Coursera: from University of Michigan and from Google. So far 3 weeks have passed and I can say a few words about them.I am a more or less experienced interface designer, so both courses for me so far for the most part are filled with already known information (they are designed for very beginners).  Although I took on them strictly because of the certificates, there is also useful and interesting information there.Specifics in comparison:  In the Google course, there is a lot (a lot!) of water and a continuous theory with tests. But there is also a plus: everything is divided into short videos with stylish visual design, and the theoretical part contains useful techniques.  In the course of the University of Michigan, already in the second week there was a practical task (and already quite difficult). There are more specific examples here. This seems to be a more solid course.üéÑIf this info was useful to you, I will be very grateful for a like or a comment on the topic (for example, what courses did you take or what do you think about certificates) üêØ#ux #–∫—É—Ä—Å—ã #–¥–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω #–∫—É—Ä—Å—ã–¥–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω–∞ #—Å–µ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ç #–¥–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω #–∫—É—Ä—Å–µ—Ä–∞ #userexperience #google #coursera #certificate #course #designcourse

Eng version bellow ‚§µ–Ø –±—ã–ª —É–≤–µ—Ä–µ–Ω, —á—Ç–æ –º–æ–π —É—Ä–æ–≤–µ–Ω—å –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —ç—Ç–æ –≥–¥–µ-—Ç–æ A2-B1 (Elementary-Intermediate) ‚Äî –Ω–∏–∂–µ —Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–µ–≥–æ. –Ø —Ç–∞–∫ –∏ –Ω–∞ —Å–æ–±–µ—Å–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è—Ö –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª. –†–µ—à–∏–ª –ø—Ä–æ–π—Ç–∏ –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä—ã–π —Ç–µ—Å—Ç –Ω–∞ EF Set –∏ —É—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏—Ç—å –∫–∞–∫ —Ç–∞–º –Ω–∞ —Å–∞–º–æ–º –¥–µ–ª–µ. –û–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–æ—Å—å, —É –º–µ–Ω—è –≥–¥–µ-—Ç–æ –º–µ–∂–¥—É C1 –∏ C2 ‚Äî advanced –∏ proficient. –ü—Ä–æ–¥–≤–∏–Ω—É—Ç—ã–π —Å–ø–∏–∫–µ—Ä, —Ç–∞–∫ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å (–ø–æ–Ω—è–ª –≤—Å—ë –Ω–∞ —Å–ª—É—Ö –∏ –ø–æ—á—Ç–∏ –≤—Å—ë –≤ —Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–µ).–ï—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ, —á–∞—Å–æ–≤–æ–π —Ç–µ—Å—Ç –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–º, –Ω–æ —É–∂–µ –ø–æ —ç—Ç–æ–º—É –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–æ–º—É –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç—å, —á—Ç–æ —è –∏—Å–ø—ã—Ç–∞–ª –Ω–∞ —Å–µ–±–µ "—Å–∏–Ω–¥—Ä–æ–º —Å–∞–º–æ–∑–≤–∞–Ω—Ü–∞" (—ç—Ç–æ –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–µ–¥–æ–æ—Ü–µ–Ω–∏–≤–∞–µ—à—å —Å–≤–æ–∏ —É–º–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ –Ω–∞–≤—ã–∫–∏).ü•Ç –í –æ–±—â–µ–º, –∂–µ–ª–∞—é –≤ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–º –≥–æ–¥—É —Å–µ–±–µ –∏ –≤–∞–º –∏–∑–±–µ–≥–∞—Ç—å "—Å–∞–º–æ–∑–≤–∞–Ω—Ü–µ–≤" –∏ –±—ã—Ç—å —É–≤–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º–∏ –≤ —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö —Å–∫–∏–ª–ª–∞—Ö ü•Ç(–≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–µ –¥–æ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∞ –î–∞–Ω–Ω–∏–Ω–≥–∞-–ö—Ä—é–≥–µ—Ä–∞ –Ω–µ –¥–æ–π—Ç–∏ üßê) ~ ~ ~I was sure that my level of English is somewhere A2-B1 (Elementary-Intermediate) ‚Äî below the average.  That's what I said in interviews.  I decided to take a quick test on the EF Set and clarify how it really is.  It turned out that I have somewhere between C1 and C2 - advanced and proficient. I understood everything by ear and almost everything in the text. Naturally, the one-hour test will be more representative, but already from this short one i can understand that I have experienced the "impostor syndrome" (this is when you underestimate your skills and abilities). ü•Ç In general, in the new year I wish myself and you to avoid "impostors" and be confident in our skills ü•Ç (the main thing is not to reach the Dunning-Kruger effect üßê) #english #b1 #c1 #c2 #advanced #proficient #efset #cefr EF Education First, EF Standard English Test (EF SET)
