Hands-on approach or how to prevent problems with performers  How to communicate properly with the performer in order not to miss possible problems at work? I want to recommend the ‚Äúhands-on‚Äù approach.Using this approach, you need to control what exactly people are doing at each stage of work; otherwise, due to the ‚Äúcontext-free management‚Äù, the specialist may misunderstand the task and may spend a lot of time on it, so he is not in time, and it‚Äôs your fault because you didn‚Äôt control what he was doing. In this case, claims will be specifically on the project manager and not just on the specialist: why didn‚Äôt he control and stop the performer earlier, why didn‚Äôt he understand that the specialist was doing the wrong thing. To avoid context-free management, you need to ask targeted questions. It is clear that it is easier to ask ‚Äúdid you do it?‚Äù and get the answer ‚Äúyes, I did‚Äù. But in reality, this approach will bring you many unexpected problems during commissioning. If you ask a few clarifying questions about the logic and implementation technologies or dig deeper into the smallest details in one particular task that you feel is problematic, you can find many important errors, so it will help you not blush in front of the client during commissioning.  If you do not understand the essence of the task, the chances are high that it will be completed incorrectly. When answering clarifying questions, you can reveal either that the person is lying or that he did not take into account something and got confused.Therefore, feel free to ask clarifying questions; you do not look stupid because of this. So it will be clear to the interlocutor, especially when in this way you will find his mistake.You also can learn more with my course https://lnkd.in/dYiS_jVr#projects #projectmanagement #it #approaches #projectmanager #communication #work #management #project

What technical skills does a project manager need?IT project manager is a person who combines both analytical and technical skills. However, it is worth noting that these qualities are not considered mandatory, but they will help you a lot in your work.HTML/CSS - HTML is a hypertext markup language. CSS is a style description language. It describes the appearance of HTML elements. If you plan to work in development, then these skills will come useful.Basic programming functions. Here the programming language does not matter. It is necessary to have an understanding at the level of standard functions: if, then, start/stop. sort, etc. So it will be easier for you to read the specialists‚Äô code and even suggest solutions during the brainstorming process.The basics of mechanical and automated testing (QA). Here you will need knowledge at the level of testing types in order to understand how automated testing services are configured. You don't need to know how to set it up individually. Types of document formatting. Here you need to know what types of formats exist for: text documents (TXT, RTF, DOC, DOCX, HTML, PDF), images (RAW, JPEG,TIFF,PSD,PNG) and video files (MP4,M4P,MOV,MKV ). It is also desirable to understand how they differ from each other and how to convert one format to another.Basic design skills. For web development or for those projects where the design is used, you will need skills such as: unload icons from design in photoshop layers, look at the type of font or check the RGB color code. It will also be useful to be able to compare the design with the pixel perfect layout.Basic knowledge in system administration. In this case, the required knowledge depends on the type of manageable projects. I will only note that here you need to understand the types of hosting, how the server is configured, what software is responsible for what, what logs are available and how the mail is working at the mail server.Any skills (hard or soft skills), are best developed through practice. And if you want to make it easier to move from theory to practice, you can learn more with my course https://lnkd.in/dYiS_jVr#work #development #projectmanagement #projectmanager #IT #itprojectmanagement #skills #itprojects #hardskills

4 principles of effective team communication The success of each project directly depends on the team and its specialists. They are the participants of the project work with whom you constantly have to communicate. The best way is to start selecting and forming a team before you start the work. Even if you have such people, it is better to clarify their employment status and inform them about the time when the project is planned to be executed. It is necessary to do, so that they plan their work according to it. Regardless of whether you work with full-time or freelance professionals, I advise you to pay attention to such things as: - work exclusively by preliminary budgeting;- if you don't want to lose people during the project, you should monitor the mood of each team member and in advance raise the conversation about the reasons for a bad mood, exceeded timeframes and negative statements;- welcome the initiative in the team. It's good when you have such an atmosphere in your team in which any person can offer his own solution to the problem, and he will not be thrown with rotten tomatoes;- improve your technical literacy and speak with programmers in their language.Excellent results will be obtained only with well-coordinated and harmonized work of the entire team.I paid a special attention to the work with performers in my course materials where you can learn more https://lnkd.in/dYiS_jVr#projectmanagement #projectmanager #it #itprojects #itprojectmanagement #teamwork #projectleader #management #team #communication

Work/life balance or life as the most important project  Very often managers forget that in addition to the projects that they do for clients, there are no less, but rather more important ones. These projects include: your family, relationships with friends or a hobby that brings you joy and make you feel the fullness of life. There are also some resources in your life that you use, deadlines that are important to fit in, and KPI metrics.The fact, that in the IT field people often work overtime, is not new. It is a big advantage that IT specialists can work wherever there is the Internet, but it also their divine judgment. After all, projects work 24/7, but such a schedule is difficult for people. It is important to monitor your condition and not drive yourself to the point of burnout. Rest should not be taken as a deadtime, but as a revival.I want to share a technique that helps you prioritize correctly and save yourself from projects and tasks that steal your time without bringing enough profit. I resort to it every time I notice that I start to work overtime systematically. It can be compared to clearing the closet of unnecessary things that fill the space. So you need to:- monitor where your time goes by keeping a calendar;- make an analysis of the distribution of your time on projects for a calendar month;- evaluate your projects in terms of benefits (profit, experience, self-realization) that you can get from them in relation to the time you spend on them;- cut off all that you don't need. If the project takes up most of your time, despite the fact that its benefit to you is insignificant, then you should not be afraid to part with it.It is rightly said that ‚Äúthere‚Äôs always more fish in the sea‚Äù, but the time spent with loved ones as well as your physical and mental health is priceless. Life time is limited and at the end of your life you will be ready to buy this time for any money.Have you experienced burnout and how did you deal with it? Share your experience in the comments to the post, for all those who now want to find a way out of constant overtime work.#work #mentalhealth #experience #project #projectmanagement #itprojectmanagement #balance #worklife #management

What is Hybrid Project Management? Earlier, in my posts, I shared information about development methods. Today I want to touch on such a topic as a hybrid approach.Waterfall methodology allows you to predict the work plan and project timeframe. But the sequential execution of stages requires a lot of time, which, as always, is not enough and the project must be launched as quickly as possible. This is how the hybrid Waterfall was invented. Here the sequence of only critically interconnected processes is observed, and some of the development stages are parallel. This approach to development is currently considered the most effective by the American Project Management Institute (PMI), because it allows you to save time and is also well predicted. So, for example, after the project documentation, we can start programming while the design and layout are being developed. After the layout is ready, it will be combined with the developed functionality, giving it a design certified with the client. It saves a lot of project time, but it also contains potential problems. Such a development process is much more dependent on the discipline of the project manager, because if you miss changes in the process of working on the front, you can then spend a lot of time on finalizing the backend. Hybrid approach will give you the ability to combine methodologies and create new, more effective methods suited to specific projects.Which of the methodologies do you prefer in your work?You can learn more from my course https://lnkd.in/dYiS_jVr#development #projectmanagement #projectmanager #projectmanagerit #projectmanagementcoach #projectleader #it #management #projects

Agile VS Waterfall: what should you take into account?  Before starting the development of an IT project, the first question that arises is: ‚ÄúWhich methodology should you choose?‚Äù The choice should be made based on the requirements collected from the client. The wrong choice of methodology can adversely affect the project. It is worth noting the most commonly used methodologies - Waterfall, Agile and its derivative - Scrum. Waterfall is a sequential execution of tasks. So, the next stage of work begins only after the previous stage of work is completed. For example, layout development begins only after the design is completed, and programming development begins after the layout is completed. This methodology allows you to predict the work plan and project dates, but the sequential execution of stages requires a lot of time. What is Agile and Scrum?It's a development process where you don't have deadlines or final project costs. For such projects is assembled a team; tasks are given for a week or two. It's called sprints. A list of tasks certified with the client is developed as part of these sprints. At the end, it is rated how many of the tasks have been completed. This methodology is called flexible because it allows you to change priorities during the development process. But, unfortunately, it is often of less priority for the customers, because they do not have confidence in the performers, they do not understand clear deadlines and clear cost of the project.Each project is unique. The right choice of methodology allows you to use the resources effectively, reducing the risks of errors in the project.You can learn more from my course https://lnkd.in/dYiS_jVr#work #development #Agile #Waterfall #projectmanagement #it #itspecialist #itmethodology

Check how well you know the terminologyRoadMap - a plan for improving or creating a product with a breakdown of this plan into stages with an indication of the time for their implementation.Soft - is the same as software only in computer terminology slang. Feature - a function or an option of a product or service.OKR (objectives and key results) - is a method used in modern management for planning and evaluating work on a quarterly basis. It allows you to synchronize team and individual goals. Assumes the evaluation of results, the process does not matter.Visualization board (Kanban board) or a scrum board - is a board that visualizes the progress of work. In the case of a Kanban board, space is divided into "Planned", "In Development", "Testing", and "Done" blocks. Tasks (most often written on stickers) are moved across the board to the area corresponding to their status of execution.Sprint Review - is summarizing the results of the sprint with a demonstration of the executed work. The team and other stakeholders are involved.Bug - an error, a malfunction. Usually applied to IT products.UX (user experience) - the experience that the user receives while working with the product.Mockup - a crude scheme of the future product.Are all the words familiar to you?You can learn more from my course https://lnkd.in/dYiS_jVr#kanban #work #management #projectmanagement #projectmanager #projectmanagerit #projectmanagementcoach #agile #scrum #waterfall #it

Who is a project manager? This is a person who is on the same page with clients, collects necessary requirements, and then summarizes all the information into the language of IT specialists. Creators vs #influencers ?Creators and influencers are both individuals who produce and share content online, often with the goal of building a following and generating income. However, there are some key differences between the two terms:1. #content focus: Creators typically focus on producing and sharing a particular type of content, such as videos, music, art, or writing. Influencers, on the other hand, may focus on promoting products or brands and may not produce as much original content.2. #audience interaction: Creators often have a more direct relationship with their audience and may interact with them through comments, direct messages, and live streams. Influencers may have a more distant relationship with their audience and may focus more on promoting products or brands rather than interacting with their followers.3. #monetization : Both creators and influencers may monetize their content through advertising, sponsorships, and paid collaborations. However, creators may be more focused on monetizing their own content, while influencers may be more focused on promoting products or brands in exchange for payment.Overall, the main difference between creators and influencers is the focus of their content and the way they interact with their audience.What is a #creator #economy?The creator economy refers to the growing trend of individuals creating and sharing content online, often with the goal of generating income. Creators in the creator economy may produce a wide range of content, including videos, music, art, writing, and more. They may use platforms such as YouTube, Patreon, and Twitch to share their content and interact with their audience. The creator economy has allowed many people to build a following and monetize their content through advertising, sponsorships, and paid subscriptions. It has also provided a way for creators to connect with their audience directly and build a community around their content.

5 Simple Growth Hacks for Your #marketing #strategy Are you looking to boost your marketing efforts and drive growth for your business?Try implementing these growth hacks:1. Leverage social media influencers: Partnering with social media influencers in your industry can help increase brand awareness and drive traffic to your website.2. Utilize referral marketing: Encourage your satisfied customers to refer their friends and family to your business by offering incentives such as discounts or loyalty points.3. A/B test your marketing campaigns: Experiment with different versions of your marketing campaigns to determine which approach is most effective. This could include testing different subject lines for emails or different ad creatives for paid ads.4. Optimize for conversions: Make sure your website is optimized for conversions by including clear calls to action, streamlining the purchasing process, and ensuring a seamless user experience.5. Utilize retargeting: Retargeting involves showing ads to users who have previously visited your website. This can be an effective way to bring back users who may have left your site without taking action.By implementing these growth hacks, you can drive more traffic and conversions for your business.#business #growth #marketing #socialmedia #marketingstrategy

Let's keep on talking about NFT. I'm gonna share with you the most practical (maybe basic), details you need to consider if you are promoting an NFT project or launching your own. So here are all the key points to lead your NFT project to success:- Always analyze the market before you start doing something- Create a community of NFT enthusiasts in discord (and not only)- Chat a lot, and keep your community super active! Believe me, they will always tell you whether you are in the right direction or not- Always test the idea and visuals! Never rely on your subjective views - start with a simple MVP, get signals, and then the market situation itself and the community 'needs' will tell you how to move on - remember, the more tests and validation of hypotheses you carry out, the more likely is your success- Show your face, reveal yourself to your contacts on Linkedin! People must know who is behind the idea and who exactly developed the project, whether you should be trusted or not.Things you should avoid doing when launching your NFT project- Do not boost your social networks with bots- Do not ever use grey market methods of promotion at all (you're just foolin' yourself)- Do not buy traffic over and over again if it does not pay off- If you have failures, tell the community, and get support from them- Don't hide your face! This is very important, show your community who you are and what you have under your belt.#community #project #marketing #nft #blockchain

I'm excited to catch up with our partners in person at #automateshow2023! And even though I spent most at the meetings, I had a chance to walk through the show.Here are my key takeaways and subjective observations from the show:-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Cobots made up almost 50% of the robots on display, illustrating the expanding trend of collaborative automation.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†In the welding sector, it seemed like 90% of the booths featured pre-engineered cobot welding cells on movable tables.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†A Cobot welding cell with a table may be a convenient starting point for small parts, but for a few 3D models and when welding in jigs, especially when you consider how inexpensive it is. However, it becomes just as time-consuming to program as a typical industrial robot if you only add a positioner to the cell, or weld without jigs and increase the number of different 3D modesl. -¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Although many companies say they use cobots for welding, not all of them are equipped with a unique protective metal or cover. And even though everyone talks about how flexible cobots are and how you can use them on pillar gantries or gantries, I believe that standard industrial robots are better for large and more flexible systems because they at least have a place for wire feeder in welding solutions and have hollow wrists, which are essential if you want a flexible solution for welding and painting without having a problem with cable management.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Around 30% of the show focused on vision-related technologies, highlighting the importance of advanced imaging and perception systems.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Many solutions are about software. Many businesses don‚Äôt see much difference in robotic arms themselves, but prioritizing affordability, lead time, and service when selecting supplier.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Roughly 40-50% of the exhibits focused on logistics, showcasing AGVs, grippers, and robots for handling, pick and place, and palletizing applications.¬†What were your key takeaways from Automate 2023? Share your thoughts in the comments below! #automate2023 #roboticsindustry #weldingrobot #visionsystem #roboticsolutions

Do you really see robots in our business? (a customer story)¬†-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†DO you REALLY SEE ROBOTS in our productions?! ‚Äì the Head of welding department Mr. Pashan was asked by the GM of the company several years ago.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†I mean, DON‚ÄôT YOU SEE thatROBOTS CANNOT BE USED in our production with high mix of products?!!! ‚Äì GM repeated his question. ¬†Our customer told us this story which happened several years ago.In fact, there are lots of companies I meet which tell me the same: ‚ÄúRobots simply are not for our business, we have bespoke / customized / non-serial / high mix / high variance production‚Äù¬†And that made me think of 2 stories:-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†In 2006 the results of experiment with Himba tribe from Namibia was published. In their language there is no word for blue color, and they don‚Äôt make difference between green and blue. So, when they were shown a circle with many green and one blue square, members of the tribe could not point at the different square. The hypothesis, that they simply don‚Äôt see it.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Another story is about The Invisible ships Phenomenon (story or myth) stating that native Americans couldn‚Äôt see European ships arriving and ignored them. They say as natives didn‚Äôt see ships before and their brains don‚Äôt have ship‚Äôs image, they simply failed to ‚Äòsee‚Äô them.¬†What if the same story may be with robots effectively used in industries, where they were not feasible before?¬†You are welcome come and meet Mr. Pashan, the Head of welding department, and listen to his story about 5 robots used in welding for steel and bridge structures even though he was told it was not possible. For 2-3 years using robots the company was able to weld thousands of different products in an easy and fast way.¬†For German speaking participants we are having Online factory visit on January 27 at 11:00 CET. Online live factory visits - are the new cool  I remember once my auditing expert told me that the best and creative time she had with the customer requests is the economical crisis - businesses want to survive and do everything possible for that.  The same feeling I had last week when we had to transform our offline event with the customer into online format. I was convincing the customer for some time to get a very unique opportunity when the management agreed to host an event at the factory and open not only the doors into each innovative machinery they use but to share economical, technical and productive insights with the invited guests. We selected carefully non-competetive attendees until the local govenment announced lockdown.  For us,¬†KUKA sales and¬†Fronius Perfect Welding¬†distributor it's a new norm just to switch into online. But can you imagine what that means to make it possible to present all the details not in person, but online in a limited period of time for a chief welder who's responsibility to be on site and for example for a technical director, who knows every corner at this factory for over than 50 year?  Well, what I can say now after completing several online factory visits with conservative manufacturers who are not used to online: - I have a detailed event scenario for such online live factory visits to scale it with any potential customer; - No expensive online platforms and event director are required as we used to have even 1 year ago. Every company can do it. We simply use Zoom webinar now and I have a detailed scenario with the flow and responsible roles of the support team like for a professional event organiser; - Planning, agenda and minimum 3 full rehearsals are the must for the factory people. I'm not kidding. Rehearsals, dry runs and once again as there might be issues even with demonstrating the screen; - Educate the factory people about presentations as they used to talk in person, not giving pictures online. And they have to prepare written speech because they will be limited in time compare to personal meetings; - Always compress any video to be shown; - Macro video shooting, focusing on details is required to create a feeling that you can see everything at the factory by yourself, not only overview videos; - Internal communications with the organising team and speakers can be done for example via discord (they have an option to be used in a walkie-talkie mode and speaker could have just a headphone in the the ears to listen to) or a messanger group with phone on silent but visible messages on a screen.  And I must admit that the interest from the participants is rising to online opportunities as well the the trust grows to what is shown. Thus, I was able to get 3 times more attendies compare to the year ago.What tips do you have to host online events with your customers?#onlineconference #webinar #opportunities #kukarobotics #fronius #froniuswelding #robotics #sales

Feeling great for Abagy to be chosen as a winner in #Photoneo Best Application 2021 Competition. Wishing both our companies to revolutionazied traditional robotic welding market and get the new niche in applications for non-serial production!

Dreaming about summer break?That's the privilage of a human :)Our customers' robots are on duty 24/7 with no option for vacation, no sick leave or hangover, but rather performing consistent high quality

1 or 2 robots to use in one cell?If you have enough volume to work with and despite that initial cost for 2 robots maybe higher, I suggest to consider the productivity and eventually the payback. Estimations show that cost per item always lower with 2 robotsPlus, make a decision for several working zones to save time on loading:- if you have 2 robots on 1 linear motion, working zones could be on both sides- if you have 2 robots on 2 linear motions, working zone could be long enough for several parts to load.In terms of programming, for our software it's equially easy and efficient either to program 1 robot or 2 robots. Besides the system distributes the work between two robots automatically in the most efficient way. 1) Load 3D models of products2) Select the required seams and define their parameters3) Set the sequence of seamsAnd you're done. The robots carry out the task without interfering with each other.¬†#robotics #kukarobotics #froniuswelding #photoneo

New robotic cell powered by Abagy is there.We have successfully launched a new welding cell with Abagy software for final welding of tack welded products.The customer can weld any parts to be placed in a working zone 23,5m x 3,8m x 1,4m (length x width x height)Which means a great¬†variety and a mix of completely different steel work. That was not economically feasible without Abagy software as programming and adapting the program to the real part with it's deviations take a lot of time, a lot!And now, the customer¬†enjoys 70%-80% of the arc time with no extra personnel involved, just a worker who feeds the cell and presses the start button. Welding parameters, robot¬†programm, adapting¬†to deviations and heat deformations are done by the system automatically.The customer¬†has designed the configuration of the cell and installed 1 #Kuka robot with #Fronius welding set on a gantry, while #Abagy was responsible for optical vision #Photoneo and smart adaptive software.

Robotics programming.A common workflow involves programming robots and then adapting them to particular deviations of a real partin a real-life environment. This takes hours if not days.Abagy solves the same problem in a matter of minutes, eliminating coding from the workflow. Robot movements arecalculated on-the-fly, making the system adaptable to environmental changes, deviated parts, and deformations duringthe execution.Let's take it to step by step:1. 3D Model Upload ~ 2 min3D Model can be taken from any CAD program2. Task Definition ~ 5 minDefine the order of operations and welding parameters3. Workzone loading ~ 1-15 minAn operator places a pre-assembled part freely in the working area, no reference points required, clamps in random position can be put, adapting to new fixtures - no problem4. Scanning, path planning ~ 1-5 minABAGY scans the working area and automatically adjusts the program to the real workpiece.Thus, the time for robot programming is reduced tremendously and just a standard welding knowledge is required
2D sensors at work with welding applications run by Abagy

Utility poles.When welding utility poles, attachments are places in different places and they are tack welded manually. That means the design is always different and adaptation to deviations from manuall assembly is required.We did a trial part to show you the general idea how such poles might be welded with robot and how easy it is to use robots with Abagy adaptive software with no programming required (just indicating welding plan)https://lnkd.in/gXQinux

This picture is a great example to show, which deviations we are working with and automatically adapting robot program to the real workpiece without human engineer involved. Orthotropic deck is just placed as it is, the rest is done by the scanner and Abagy software.Width of this deck is 3 meters.

I am shocked when I hear the stories that it takes so long to program robots. Like for example with welding:- 1 month to program dump body truck + 0,5 month to teach/adapt the robot to the real part;- 2 days to program excavator bucket + 2 days to teach/adapt the robot to the real part;- 4 days to program a part with fixtures with around 20 welds + 4 days to teach/adapt the robot to the new part and new fixture;- 1 day to program bridge structure + 1,5 days to teach/adapt robot to each part 'cos assembly is done manually.And here what I have from Abagy:-> bridge structure: 84 welds, 165,4 meters of welds-> robotic cell with 2 robots on linear motions - working at the same time;-> 6,5 minutes to create tech chart maually (video speed is 8x)-> 7 minutes programming is done automatically and robots can start welding first 41 welds;-> touch sensing as well is automatically programmed;-> while welding is in progress, other seams are being automatically programmed for futher weldingNot month, not days, not even hours of programming!#robotprogramming #roboticsautomation #weldingautomation #roboticwelding #welds #weldinglife #kuka #fanuc #yaskawa #abb

Welding parameters.With our interface we give a flexibility to the welding engineer to set up own welding parameters for any particular case.As well welding engineer can use default parameters from our database and check which one is more acceptable. In this case weld number 19 (default by Abagy) has following:- leg a5, horizontal- welding process PMC- welding speed 45 cm/min- work/travel angel 0/10- offset on the wall (lower/upper, mm) 1/0- no weavings- gap between plates 1 mmWeld number 4 (customer settings for testing):- leg a5, horizontal- welding process PMCMIX- welding speed 32 cm/min- work/travel angel 0/10- offset on the wall (lower/upper, mm) 0/0- no weavings- gap between plates 1 mm#welding #roboticwelding #wps #weldingautomation #weldinginspection #weldingquality #welds

Test robotic welding with usUsually customers want to perform test on robotic welding with their own part. In a current situation one cannot easily travel and it may be not efficient to send the metal parts either.So, in this case we are able to make the testing part by customer drawings and perform welding with the live stream.   All nessasary welding settings are tested by our partner as well as quality check.Here is the video how the test is performed without arc and with arc (speed 8x)#roboticwelding #welding #weldingautomation #welded

A diversified group operating within the EU opens a strategic position of the Chief AI Technology Officer (CATO).The main objective of this role is to build and strengthen the Group's core competence: the ability to optimally implement cutting-edge AI advancements in applied projects.This role involves the creation of a system dedicated to preserving this core competence in its entirety, covering both its substantive and legal aspects, hence positioning it as a strategic asset of the Group.This role also involves staying up-to-date with the latest technology trends. By doing so, the Group can ensure that AI is utilized in the most effective manner across all its innovative projects.In practical terms, this role involves enlisting subcontractors for specific tasks, thus maximizing the utilization of specialist skills and minimizing the Group's costs associated with the building and application of the core competence.As the leading specialist in AI, the individual in this role will be responsible for spreading AI-based solutions across all business units of the Group. They will coordinate the activities of the Group Board's Technology Committee.Required qualifications:1. Extensive experience in AI research and development, with a deep understanding of machine learning, deep learning, and generative networks.2. I love Apple. But some moments in their interface could be slightly better, in my opinion. Dynamic Island is great, but what about screens that have not changed for years? Pretty important screens. It's pretty stressful when your phone is out of battery. But it's even more stressful to understand whether it is charging or not. Especially if you need to call, write a message, or take an Uber ASAP.Through some small user testing, I figured out there is not only me who faced issues understanding the screen. I asked people, "Which picture says the charger is not connected?" And 9 people answered the left while 12 answered the right.I understand there are many layers to making decisions before anything goes live in Apple. So I am curious to hear from a design community why this screen looks like this and to listen to feedback about my suggested screens below.Thanks!Oh, and it's my first post on Linkedin!#design¬†#community¬†#people¬†#testing¬†#apple¬†#iphone¬†#ios¬†#ios16

The only way that Putin can win is if Zelensky makes a settlement .Russia's campaign in Ukraine has exposed the ineptness of the Russian armed forces . All their operations thus far have failed , their technology either doesn't work or is thirty years behind the systems owned by the western powers . Every day that Ukraine resists is a nail in Russia's coffin . Russia cannot maintain a long war , it is losing too much equipment and men and it doesn't have the ability to replace them .The Rouble is being artificially held up , the Russian stock market has been banned from selling , foreign business assets are being stolen . These short term funding attempts will run out in a matter of months and Russian will struggle to raise capital to rebuild , they will have bitten the hand that feeds them . No one will invest in them twice. The money Russia earns from fossil fuels will diminish as the west gradually reduces their dependence on Russian oil . That will not return . In the long term Russia is already screwed . Financially Russia is small fry compared to NATO . The economies of the united democracies can outbuy him a hundred times . They have more money , more stuff and more people . On top of that Russia is bleeding experts , the young professionals are running for the door. In the short term Putin needs a military victory but it's hard to see how that can be achieved now that western arms and training are arriving in the war zone . The mud ( as I previously mentioned ) is slowing the Russian advance . Moving in the Spring was simply foolish .Russian troops are dissatisfied and demoralised . Generals are either in prison or in the ground , every time a Russian HQ sets up it gets hit ( No one is asking why ? ) . The ships in the Black Sea have withdrawn out of range of Odessa for fear of Neptune Missiles .If Zelensky holds his nerve and stays in the fight for another ten weeks Russia will be unable to hold Ukraine or the Black Sea . They will threaten terrible consequences , they will stamp their feet , they will look to save face but it will be too late .The best hope for Putin is to take his troops home and salvage what he can , but he won't . He will send his armies into a futile battle and drag his country back a hundred years . His brutal actions might be the catalyst that finally finishes the Russian Empire once and for all . #Ukraine #Russia #Zelensky #Putin #NATO

A motivated team in an outstaff trio. How to achieve it? In theory, to build a successful relationship you just need to follow the rules of a healthy business ethics.But there is one ‚ÄúBut‚Äù. Outstaffers are in a unique position because they have two management teams. Both customers and outstaff providers should build a unique motivation system to get their team charged for success.Here are some recommendations that OGDSolutions O√ú has made for you.1. Ensure transparency and accountability.Daily short reports track project progress, celebrate progress, and allow people to evaluate their contributions. Regular feedback from the outstaff company also increases productivity.2. Provide communication between the three parties.Short meetings foster personal connections and can be about performance, proposals, or rewards. They help to bring the team together and create a common goal. In our team, the Support Manager is responsible for these connections. He organizes meetings with the developer and keeps his finger on the pulse.We highlighted these and other responsibilities of a support manager in one of our previous posts.3. Avoid red tape.Bureaucracy is the antonym of motivation. It is also the acknowledged enemy of creativity and innovation. Ensure that all conversations are substantive. Minimize unnecessary forms, and replace them with short but frequent calls.4. Practice one-on-one meetings.Set aside time every quarter to discuss goals and progress with each team member. During the meetings, you will be able to learn about the nuances of their work: the factors that motivate or demotivate them. Our support manager regularly receives feedback from the developers and adjusts the working conditions if necessary.5. Give thanks.It is a practice on teams where employees feel valued. Sometimes even a short thank-you note or a couple of kind words can be a powerful motivator for a team member.And what techniques to improve motivation in the outstaff team do you know? Which of our methods will you use? Share in the comments.#OGDSolutions #outstaffing #motivation

In today's globalized business environment, remote work has become the norm. And it has increased the importance of effective communication. Here we'll discuss how employers can improve communication with remote developers.‚Äî Establish clear communication channels.It may include email, messaging applications, video conferencing, and project management tools. Employers need to be sure they have a reliable internet connection while remote team members have access to the tools they need.‚Äî Schedule regular checks.Do it in video conferences or messaging apps. Regular checks help build trust and be sure everyone is on the same wavelength.‚Äî Use project management tools.You must have the tools to track the progress of your remote team members. Use Trello, Asana, Jira or Basecamp. There are times when your team is dispersed across different time zones. Therefore, you need to immediately discuss the time of calls and choose a convenient task manager.‚Äî Be specific.Give detailed instructions and feedback. Avoid using ambiguous language or assumptions. You must know that team members understand what is expected of them.‚Äî Encourage open communication.Ask employees to write reviews about projects. Your task is to create an atmosphere of equality and trust so that everyone can make a question or comment on the situation.Effective communication is critical to the success of remote teams. By following these tips, employers can improve communication with their remote developers and be sure everyone is working towards the same goal.#OGDSolutions #outstaffing #remotework #remoteteam

Outsourcing and outstaffing are products of the era of globalization and remote work. How did they affect the global economy and what to expect? Let's figure it out.‚Äî Increasing competition.Outsourcing and outstaffing help companies access a wider range of talent. By outsourcing work to specialized service providers, companies can tap into the expertise of professionals who may not be available in the local labor market. Outstaffing also allows companies to scale their workforce based on their needs.Here it is important to notice the following chain: the more competition, the better the chosen specialist, and the better the quality of the final product. The market is growing due to competition, so this is a clear plus.‚Äî Cost reduction as an incentive to invest.¬†By outsourcing jobs to countries with lower labor costs, companies can reduce operating costs and increase profit margins. "Extra" profit is often used for investment. And this, in turn, is one of the main pillars of economic development.‚Äî Closing the gap between the richest and the poorest countries.Today, by giving a job to a developer from a developing country, you have a profit for your team and act as shareholders in the development of other countries. It is one of the challenges that stand in the way of the prosperity of the world economy.What are the prospects for outstaffing and outsourcing?As you guessed it is expected that they will continue to grow in the future. Stay on trend and competitive with OGDSolutions O√ú.#OGDSolutions #outstaffing #WorldEconomy

What are the main benefits of smart outstaffing? A smart method allows you to compensate for the lack of skills of a hired specialist. After all, if necessary, he can always turn to the expertise of other employees of his outstaffing company.In addition, thanks to a well-established knowledge-sharing system, smart outstaffing allows the supplier to quickly replace a specialist with another in case he leaves the project. A super common question I get from first-time founders: how can I lead a tech team while I'm a non-tech person?Short answer: you shouldn't lead it.There are several ways that I see non-tech founders can successfully run a SaaS business:- CEO (non-tech) + CTO + in-house team- CEO (non-tech) + CTO + outsourced team- CEO (non-tech) + outsourced team (tech lead on their end)- CEO (non-tech) + CTO + augmented team (partially in-house + outsourced)All these combinations can work. Leading a tech team on your own being a non-tech person in a small startup is similar to leading a construction team without previous experience in building houses. You will get into all possible problems:- Budget overrun- Poorly organized processes- Unability to control the progress and qualityYou have many mistakes to make yourself, so don't run into those that have already been made by others.#startup #founders #ceo #business #team #experience #tech #nontech #leadership

Common arguments against building their digital products that I hear from service business founders and owners:üî¥ Everything has already been invented. üî¥ We use existing SaaS apps and spend $1500/month. It's much less than investing 50K+ to build our own.üî¥ Our primary business is providing services; we don't need a productLet me quickly address those:‚úÖ First, there are 1000+ service businesses like yours. How do you find clients for your existing business if you have existing competitors?‚úÖ Even $1500/month for 3 years will give you a $50K spending on 3rd party software that doesn't accumulate anything. Just money spent. As you grow, $1500 will become $3000 or $10K (most B2B SaaS apps charge per seat). In contrast, your own product will have approx. fixed monthly cost for servers and maintenance. Your own app is something that brings additional value to your company. It brings additional valuation as IP if you want to sell your business. It also is a competitive advantage. Finally, it is tailored specifically to your industry and niche.‚úÖ Just think what happens 2-5 years ahead. Are you sure you'll be able to keep the same pace in attracting new clients? Will another world crisis affect you? Will some of your most valuable employees leave your company?You don't know, and you can't predict the future. Building another revenue channel and additional software assets is investing in your business's future, making it more stable by removing 3rd party dependencies, reducing costs, and generating revenue through another channel. This is risk management as well.#saas #founders #products #business #digitalproducts #b2b #investing #building #software #future #maintenance #money #riskmanagement #digital

Look at your existing niche.2. Talk to your clientsDon‚Äôt miss this step.You need to speak with 20+ potential clients of your product.¬†Find out if they experience the pain that you‚Äôre going to address. How big is that? Are they ready to pay for a solution?Be true to yourself here.3. Create a PoCA good step is building a quick Proof-of-concept and showing it to your potential customers. Get some feedback, change and iterate quickly.PoC can be a low/no-code solution built with Bubble, Zapier, Airtable, etc.4. Get pre-ordersCreate a landing page with Webflow. Promote it through your social networks and other channels, run some paid adsGet 20-100 people on your waiting list, and talk to them.5. Build the MVPAre people willing to use your product?Great, it‚Äôs time to build it!Use a modern tech stack. Don‚Äôt overcomplicate. Outsource. Let me help with that last one!I helped dozens of companies to build their SaaS products and prepared a free cheat sheet on building the SaaS MVPsJust say üëã in the comments, and I‚Äôll send a connection invite alongside the link#saas #mvp #guide #poc #founders #b2b #b2bsaas #saasfounders #experience #business #help #building #tech

Watching some of the YC School lectures this week, it's surprising how many founders choose so-called Tarpit ideas.Shortly, a Tarpit idea is very appealing to build but turns out to be a trap. Most of those ideas are around consumer-focused products, not B2B.Probably, that's because most founders are inspired by products they use - Google, Facebook, Airbnb, etc. They are all consumer-focused. And they also want to build a unicorn, at least.However, if your goal is to build a successful, profitable mid-sized SaaS business, you need to look into existing business pains and solve one of them.#founders #b2b #business #saas #tarpit

Are you building a "startup"?Interestingly, when we say "digital product," "SaaS," or "marketplace," it's almost always considered a startup by default.But it's 2023 already, and SaaS products have been around for a while. If you open a grocery store, it's not a startup. It's a small business.Why? It is more *predictable*.There are thousands of stores just like yours. That means some well-defined metrics and factors affect your success. There are franchises you can buy and be more or less sure things are done right, including location, product range, etc. There's still a place to fail of course.Getting back to digital, many of the product ideas have already been implemented. Pretty much any B2B SaaS product has 10+ competitors. And that's not bad. To have a successful SaaS business, you don't have to build a unicorn around a new unknown problem.#startup #business #success #b2b #saas #founders #2vsaasteam

‚öî Non-Tech vs. Technical founders ‚öî  Non-Tech Founders üü¢ Focus on customer needs üü¢ Usually is better in marketing/sales and can bring in real customers üî¥ Don't understand the complexity of what they want to build and usually underestimate it üî¥ Are less likely to make pivots  Tech Founders üü¢ Clearly understand the complexity üü¢ Can build parts themselves and thus are more open to pivots üî¥ Focus on features more than on customers and their needs üî¥ Usually are less market/sales focused so end up building a complex product with no users  A combination of: - non-tech and tech co-founders - non-tech founder + tech agency/external CTO - tech founder + marketing agency/external CMO  Is usually something that works better than being a solo founder of one of two types and trying to hire and manage a team by yourself from day one.  #saas #founders #foundertypes #techfounders #nontechfounders

Why do you need to think about productizing your business?While you might be a great professional in what you're doing - recruiting, marketing, HR, real estate, there are thousands of professionals and companies just like yours.You always have the option to get on a different level. One of the modern ways of doing that is building a Digital Product.You don't need to compete with other agencies the old way if you have something else that they don't have. An asset that makes you different and adds value to your offer.Imagine coming to a bicycle race in a car. That's what your product can give you.#business #digitalproduct #marketing #recruiting #rectech #martech #digital

I had 5+ offers to work based on equity instead of cash for our services in January 2023. This happens all the time.And almost always, I say NO.The founders are always sure that their idea will work out. Sometimes they even have 10-30-100 people on their waiting list.But I know how different your expectations and market reality can be. And I can't be responsible for that. I can commit to building the product MVP within the budget and timeframe, with the right scalable tech stack, and implementing the features that the founder wants. We will dive deep enough - figure out the best UX based on requirements and competitors, and proactively propose things and features that positively affect the startup unit economy. BUT there's a long list of things we can not affect: marketing, idea, founder and his/her intentions. So there are definitely risks that the founder should take. #founders #business #softwaredevelopment #tech #saas #saasfounders #2vsaasteam

You can only be professional in some things you're doing.But when you are a startup solo founder, you *have* to do everything by yourself first.And that's the right stage to do everything on your own.Create mockups in Figma, build a prototype with Bubble, conduct interviews, etc.Imagine you're in the middle of a desert, driving your car, when it suddenly breaks down. If you can fix it with sticks and stones - you'll do it survive.BUT When you have some funding, you must start delegating things. Software development, marketing, copywriting. Not ALL of them, but those you know are not your strong skills. I often see founders who are non-tech but still try to push through their technical decision and ideas.Getting back to the "car" example. Imagine you come to the BMW or Toyota service station and tell them how to replace a wheel.They have two options:- Just replace it as you said and you'll lose it after another 500 miles- Argue, spend time explaining and replace it the right wayBoth ways options are non-efficient. The best way is to let professionals do their job whatever it is.#startup #founders #software #development #softwaredevelopment #tech #trust

Free SaaS Idea (week 2)You'll find a SaaS idea below. Feel free to implement it or inspire.Industry: ‚úÖ MarTechFull-cycle AI-generated cold outreach videos.Imagine a prospect getting an individually recorded Loom video with his/her website or personal profile shown in that video and being mentioned with a personal touch.Rough implementation idea includes:- Some parsing & automated screenshots/screen recording of the target website- Creating some standardized pieces that will be common for all videos for a specific niche- Using some parsing + AI to analyze and summarize the prospect's info in a 10-20 second summary.- Having you in front of camera creating those 10-20 second videos. The system will be generating personalized 2-3 min videos for your prospects, so you don't really need to think about the process and will be able to create 150+ vids per hour.Potentially it's possible to just generate the video and audio pieces with the person speaking, but I'd say that is not the best solution since 10-20 icebreaker + specific niche personalized video message should do the job when combined seamlessly into one loom that has the prospect's website shown.#freesaaasidea #saasidea #2vsaasteam #saas #founders #ai #video #martech

So you run a service business, e.g., a recruiting agency, marketing agency or real estate agency, or %put your industry heere% agencyWhen you think of a growth strategy, there are obvious things that come to mind:More leads:- Put more money into existing channels (paid ads, cold outreach, industry platforms)- Try something new, e.g., affiliate marketing- Put more money/effort into long-term activities (personal brand, SEO)Better lead handling:- grow the sales team- grow the execution team- hire hire hire Great. But what if you look at it from a different perspective? Growing a business IS NOT doing only these straightforward things. Especially if you already have a 20-50+ people team.What if I tell you that building a digital product is a way to grow?But there is no "only right way" if you go in that direction.Your digital product has to be unique. Ideally, it has to:- solve your problems and replace existing 3rd party tools (you start saving money straight after launch)- add value to your services. So while choosing between you and your competitors, the prospect will make a decision based on the additional value that the product brings- solve similar problems for other teams and agencies. That way you can scale it with a SaaS modelIt is not a simple or cheap way for sure.BUT if you do it right - the benefits are much more than spending the same amount on one of the classic channels.That's just another way of approaching your business growth.#business #seo #growth #strategy #digital #money #building #saas #2vsaasteam

How to choose a software development company to outsource your product development? That's a complex topic but let me try to point out the main differences between the "good" and the "bad" companies.‚ùå "Bad" companies:üî¥ They will try to take your project no matter what. They don't choose their clients. This is why they start every single project they can. And fail OFTEN. They don't look at the budgets, tech challenges, or founders before they start. üî¥ Their processes are a messBased on the first point, all their projects are different. So there's no way to have standardized well-defined processes.üî¥ If they fail - you stay with your half-baked product aloneThey don't care much about reputation since they usually try to offer cheap service. That means they will not push it to the end when they run out of budget. They will just switch to another product and leave you with yours until you either pay more to finish it or just give up and go to another company with a "95% done" project.‚úÖ Good companiesüü¢ They choose the projects they take on and the clients they work with.Yes, a good company will reject more clients than those it says YES to. Because the project is not a match, the budget is too low or the communication is lacking.üü¢ Have a niche and well-defined processes for that nicheThey will lead you through well-defined steps and processes from start to finish. You'll have transparency and peace of mind from day 1 to the end of the projectüü¢ If they fail - they fix itThis is the most important. Since good companies care about their reputation, they do everything possible to satisfy the client. Even if the project takes longer or there are some issues in the process, they act proactively to fix it, and you will get your project done since profit is less important than their reputation for them.Well, we try to stay a Good company. We had projects that went not as smoothly as they should have, but we always do our best to satisfy the clients, and it results in zero negative reviews we have among dozens of reviews on multiple platforms. #tech #2vsaasteam #work #development #softwaredevelopment #founders #project #communication #projects

Solving the right problem is very important for a SaaS product.Sometimes when I talk to founders, I can see that they focus on a problem that is there, but they don't check the three factors below before going further and end up with a product that people are not ready to pay for, has a market that is too small, or can't grow.The RIGHT problem in the SaaS world means:‚úÖ Painful enough for the target audience to pay for it‚úÖ Happening with enough people/b2b customers to give you a large enough market‚úÖ Persistent. Meaning it has to be solved all the time, not just onceLet's see what happens if the problem is WRONG.‚ùå Not painful enoughLet's say your SaaS can optimize expenses and reduce them by 5%. But you're targeting companies that spend 1000 USD/month. How much can you charge for that solution? Most probably it should be free for your users, otherwise they wouldn't use it.‚ùå Not enough people experiencing the problemBased on my recent conversation. There is a very specific problem that SaaS can solve for the US attorneys. But the number of attorneys experiencing that exact problem is very small to build a dedicated solution.‚ùå Not persistentE.g. I need to generate a specific text only once. Imagine building a service and generating Terms of Service. If your SaaS only generates that single type of text, it can still exist and charge a one-time payment, but if you pivot and find a way to solve a persistent problem month over month, you can accumulate and grow your customer base and ARR.#founders #b2b #saas #saasmistakes #2vsaasteam

Each b2b #saas niche has its typical features.ANY B2B SaaS has user management, user roles, workspaces, notifications, subscription managementIndustry-specific SaaS features:RecTech - candidates' profiles, CV upload/parsing, LinkedIn connection, API integrations with industry-specific ATS like BullhornMarTech - API integrations with Facebook, IG, Snapchat, TikTok, Email sending, analytical toolsE-commerce - inventory management, order management, multi-channel integration with CMS (Magento, Shopify etc.) and channels (Amazon, Etsy, Ebay etc.)Your product should stand out by some unique features (not on that list). However, it still can utilize all those common features, especially when it's seamlessly integrated into existing workflows of a typical company from that industry.#saas #b2bsaas #2vsaasteam #rectech #martech #ecommerce

I'm starting a new series of posts under the #2vsolved hashtag.These quick posts will cover some of the tricky challenges we faced in 2V Modules while building digital and SaaS products and how we solved them.In #2vsolved #1, we'll cover a common question when you use SendGrid to send emails in your product.SendGrid is often used for both - your transactional emails (e.g., account confirmation, password reset, etc.) and your subscriptions.‚ùìProblem:The user unsubscribes from all emails and is added to a "global unsubscribe" list. This prevents him from receiving any further emails, be those common ads or important ones such as invoices or password recovery.üß† Solution:Sendgrid already has a solution for this problem, all that is required is to pass a specific filter when sending emails.There are many filters, each bypassing a different suppression list. There is also a filter that bypasses every list, which guarantees that your email will be delivered.‚úÖ Process:In the mail-send request body, add the "mail_settings" object with "bypass_list_management" set to "true". This will bypass all suppression lists.#building #solved #weekly #saas #founders #saastech #digitalproduct #techchallenge #digital #management #email

Situated minutes away to Palma‚Äôs beach, this airy residence embodies the connection to nature in the middle of the city.You enter the garden through some spectacular arches that frame the house and that are surrounded by greenery to give the house the light, color and life that characterize this area.In addition, Casa Palma Bay is located in a wonderful enclave just a few steps from the ocean and the commercial area where you can find a wide range of shops, bars and restaurants.#architecture #design #project #spain #architect #interior #interiordesign

Roman Vlasov, is an architect who designs hypnotic creations that blend in perfectly with their environment. With his concepts, he blurs the boundaries between art and architecture by proposing minimalist buildings with prominent, sometimes rounded curves, succeeding at the same time in inviting the outdoors into his creation.A true futurist designer who could be classified in the deconstructivism¬† movement, he is inspired by the great names of the end of the last century, such as Zaha Hadid and Oscar Niemeyer.Projects, architectural concepts or real orders, all its constructions are developed using the latest technologies and aim to be environmentally friendly.Numerous data are considered during the conceptualisation of the building, such as the exposure, the relief of the place, the materials available nearby... Everything is thought out to integrate the surrounding environment as well as possible.Vlasov‚Äôs work with his team of architects and designers relies heavily on curves and various forms. They make the best use of these forms to highlight the building without distorting the environment in which it stands. Even better, the place is enhanced, forming a "whole", resulting from the association of the creation and the surrounding space.#architecture #architect #design #cgi #render #project #creative

How to automate business processes?üíªüßêAutomation of business processes plays a huge role in the work of the company. It is aimed at organizing and optimizing the daily work in the company.What will help automate business processes? We have prepared for you the necessary steps that will help you achieve your goal.STEP 1: Identify tasks that are repetitive.This step helps identify areas of the company that have repetitive activities. This method will help simplify the workflow at times.STEP 2: Setting business goals.Setting goals is an important step based on key issues. This step will help analyze the overall progress of the company.STEP 3: Development of software suitable for business process automation or selection of an existing one.After you set your goals, you need to choose the right software and understand how to use the provider's services in the best possible way.What to look for when choosing software (websites, applications)?- Must be simple and clear- Have flexibility- Should integrate with already installed tools and work with saved dataSTEP 4: Performance monitoring.Be sure to check the performance of each process several times a month and look for what can be improved.Sincerely, PMP_TECH!üíú

There are many different types of neural networks, each with its own advantages and disadvantages, which can be used to solve various tasks. However, it cannot be said that any one neural network is the best at the moment, as the choice of a particular network depends on the specific task and desired results.For example, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) are often used to solve computer vision tasks such as image classification or object recognition. "ANN" stands for "Artificial Neural Network," which is a computer model that simulates the functioning of biological neural networks, allowing for various machine learning tasks to be solved. ANN consists of a network of interconnected artificial neurons that process information and transmit it to one another. Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN) can be used to work with sequential data, such as text generation or time series analysis.Recently, Transformer Neural Networks have also gained popularity, which shows excellent results in natural language processing tasks such as machine translation or text generation.Thus, the choice of a specific neural network depends on the specific task and desired results, and programmers should study different types of networks and choose the one that best suits their project.#network #neuralnetworks #elonmusk #future #ai #cnn #rnn

How do you take decisions on providing the users of your mobile application with new features?Usually, application owners take the following steps - they ask designers to draw the wireframes/mock-ups of the functionality, make budget and timeline planning with the team, and assign the implementation to mobile developers to develop, test with the QA team, brush up and roll it out to users.¬†Then the company starts to gather analytics on how users perceive the feature, use it or not and what is the feedback in general. At first glance, the process is simple and straightforward, but in most cases, it takes a lot of time and money from ‚ÄúI came up with an idea‚Äù to ‚Äúlet‚Äôs analyze now the feedback from users‚Äù.But there‚Äôs a way to save efforts & budgets, and it‚Äôs called Usability testing. This is an approach wisely used by Product managers to examine, whether users understand your new functionality and whether they need it at all.Let's see how it works. You plan a new feature. In your view, it should enhance user experience, but there‚Äôs no data to confirm that. So you ask the designers to draw the flow. From the moment you have the mock-us you you have a proof of concept. Don‚Äôt rush immediately to implement it, no matter how much it appeals to you. It should be proved before, that your customers will also find it appealing.Exactly at the stage of mock-ups, we assemble a focus group, give mockups to real people (a clickable prototype in Figma would be even preferable here) and carefully note users‚Äô behavior. For example, users may find navigation not friendly enough, or missing parts of the process, they may even doubt if they need this functionality at all while they were expecting you to improve another feature. That means your product management team may need to simplify the idea, or neglect it and come up with a different one and test its prototype anew.2-3-4 iterations might be required to describe and design the ideal flow. Now imagine how many re-development costs you may avoid by verifying your idea with the users.By the way, If it seems to be difficult to assemble a focus group, I assure you that now there‚Äôre services and tools on the market that can do this for you (should there be a separate post on them?).Remember that the success of your startup or existing application depends on your audience and their loyalty, while your app is provided to make their activities more enjoyable and solve their problems, so don‚Äôt be afraid to involve them in the UX creation process.#usabilitytesting #userexperience #ux #design #startup #applicationdevelopment #softwaredevelopment

Is it possible to understand from the very beginning if the app will be able to pass all the product cycles as a cross-platform application, whether it will be worth rewriting later with native languages, or if it‚Äôs preferable to start with the native stack right away?¬†	I believe that yes, due to the fact that we‚Äôre approaching the time when almost all the content apps will be developed in the cross-platform stack. I would categorize now all the mobile apps as content or functional ones: content - where all the logic happens on the server, and the mobile application is used only for user interaction; functional applications can perform the core functions without connecting to the server, in offline mode, the server is only a supplier of some additional data.¬†	Most content applications are focused on the UI and do not need high hardware performance and access to some special phone functions. To develop them, it is worth using a cross-platform stack, which will reduce time-to-market, and allow reaching a broad audience without losing quality or functionality.	But if you are making a Functional application, the native stack is the best and almost unquestionable choice. For functional applications, you need to work more "correctly" with memory and have access to the built-in functions of the device itself. The development will require more time and investment, but you won‚Äôt have to sacrifice the effective functionality and productivity will make the perfect product.	By the way, if you‚Äôd like to know which category your application belongs to, don‚Äôt hesitate to message me.#crossplatformdevelopment #nativeappdevelopment #mobileappdevelopment #mobileapp

When a company decides to build a mobile application, they have a choice of the native iOS & Android, cross-platform, and hybrid development options and we‚Äôre sure you may have seen dozens of articles comparing native vs cross-platform vs hybrid stacks.¬†	But have you seen comparisons dedicated purely to cross-platform vs hybrid? In many cases, they even are mistaken as different namings of the same technologies.     This article is to showcase the differences and pros and cons of cross-platform and hybrid solutions so that you have an understanding and a choice of non-native technologies and tools that would fit your needs best.#mobileapplications #mobileapps #mobileappsdevelopment #hybridapps #crossplatformdevelopment
