Your B2B SaaS product loses more customers tothe spreadsheet than your direct competitor.And here‚Äôs what to do about it üëáThe reason for that is that your website visitors might be unaware of:- What are the problems with the current solution they use- What does it cost them to have these problemsAnd here‚Äôs the process that worked for us to address these objections.First, you need to get clear on the basics:üîπ¬†(Persona) Who they‚Äôre areüîπ¬†(Company) Where do they worküîπ¬†(Job) What are they trying to get doneAnd then figure out:1Ô∏è‚É£¬†(Current solution) What do they currently use to get the job done2Ô∏è‚É£¬†(Solution problem) Why do they fail to get the job done using current solutions3Ô∏è‚É£¬†(Pain) What‚Äôs the negative outcome that not getting the job done leads to4Ô∏è‚É£¬†(Capability) How does your product address the current solution problem5Ô∏è‚É£¬†(Gain) What‚Äôs the positive outcome of getting the job doneAnd then once you‚Äôre clear on the above, communicate them on your website.Here‚Äôs an example of the message you can use:‚Ü≥ [job to be done] is important because not doing it leads to [Pain]‚Ü≥ But you fail to get it done using [Current solution] because [Solution problem]‚Ü≥ With [Our product], you now can [Capability] without [Solution problem]‚Ü≥ And as a result, achieve [Gain] from completing [job to be done]Each point can be a standalone section (or even multiple) on the page.üëâ¬†Don‚Äôt make your visitors work hard to determine how your product is better.Connect the dots for them, and make their decision easier.#plg #saas #productmarketing

Visitors don't trust the benefits on your B2B SaaS website‚Ä¶If they don't understand what product you're offering.Here's how to make it crystal clear what your product is üëáLack of clarity about the product comes down to 2 things:1. You don't explicitly state what your product is.2. You state it, but people still don't understand it.So here are 3 things you can do to fix that:1Ô∏è‚É£ Explicitly tell what your product isThat's obvious üòÖ, but not common on B2B SaaS websites.Here's how you can do it:‚Ü≥ Call out the product category in the copy‚Ü≥ Add a section that shows what's your product2Ô∏è‚É£ Make sure that your copy is clearOnce you have content on the website, you need to ensure visitors get it.Here are a couple of things to avoid that make your copy clearer:‚Ü≥ Cheesy lines & made up terms‚Ü≥ Generic claims like "all-in-one."3Ô∏è‚É£ Use product UI mockups.Showing a product interface is a great way to show your product in action.Unlike stock photos or generic illustrations, UI speaks volumes about WHAT your product is.#productledgrowth #saas #growth

Your B2B SaaS product might have multiple audiences.But when your website speaks to everyone, it speaks to no one.Here‚Äôs how to find the one that will give the highest return üëáLook at your customer base and ask yourself:- Who gets the most value out of the product?- Who has the problem the most frequently?- For whom the problem costs the most?- Who brings you 80% of the revenue?- Who‚Äôs willing to pay the most?- Who is the easiest to sell to?- Who sticks for longer?And then focus your messaging on them.You‚Äôll get more of your ideal customers and spend less time on those who aren‚Äôt a good fit.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Before you revamp your B2B SaaS website,Define if you have a horizontal or vertical product.Here‚Äôs why it matters üëáBecause it defines how well your website converts.To achieve high conversion, your website should:- Be relevant to the person who‚Äôs reading it- Show how it helps to achieve their goals- Show how it helps them to achieve their goals & problems- Speak their languageBut‚Ä¶The challenge is that horizontal products can be used:- by different people- in different ways- for different reasonsAnd when you aren‚Äôt intentional with whom you‚Äôre speaking to on the website‚Ä¶You might end up with a website that speaks to everyone but resonates with no one.#productmarketing #saas #startup

‚ÄúThe Advancing Frontier Is Already Here‚ÄùClever headlines are killing your B2B SaaS Website conversion.Here‚Äôs why üëáBecause if your prospect can imagine using your product, they won‚Äôt.Your website copy should help your prospects see themselves:- Using your product- Solving the problem- Getting the benefitAnd that‚Äôs rarely the case with sophisticated headlines.When it comes to increasing B2B SaaS Website conversion‚Ä¶Clear > Clever#productmarketing #saas #startup

‚ÄúHow to know if we have a Horizontal B2B SaaS Product?‚ÄùHere‚Äôs a bullet-proof way how to check it üëáWhen you think about your website, ask yourself these 3 questions:- Is it unclear how to communicate your value prop?- Is it challenging to structure?- Is it requires too many pages?- Is it costly to build?- Is it unclear who it is for?Then very likely that your product can be used:- by different people- in different ways- for different reasonsAnd it means that you have a horizontal product.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Website for the Product Lead B2B SaaS Company,Is the same thing as a Demo for the Sales Lead Company.Here‚Äôs why üëáYour prospects have questions & objects they want to answer to make a decision.And both your website & demo call have the same goal.Answer questions and handle objections of the customer.The difference is the medium of how your prospects get the answers.For a Product-lead company ‚Üí Search your websiteFor a Sales-lead company ‚Üí Ask a salespersonSo if you want your website to close more deals, make it more like your sales demo:- Personalize based on whom you‚Äôre talking to and what they want- Show how the product helps fix their problem- Show how the product helps achieve their goal- Answer their questions & objections- Show your product in action#productmarketing #saas #startup

Horizontal vs Vertical B2B SaaS Product Home Page‚ÄúHow are they different?‚ÄùHere‚Äôs howüëáWhether you have a horizontal product or vertical, it implies that you have multiple of something.Horizontal product ‚Üí single product, multiple audiencesVertical product ‚Üí multiple products, single audienceSo when you have multiple of anything, the main goal of your home page is to:- Give a high-level overview of what you‚Äôre offering- Build enough trust with the visitor- Take them to the relevant pageAnd that‚Äôs the shared part for both horizontal and vertical products.The difference is that the goal for the:- Horizontal product ‚Üí take you to the relevant audience page- Vertical product ‚Üí take you to the relevant product page#productmarketing #saas #startup

Does your B2B SaaS website has low conversion?It might be because it doesn‚Äôt handle your customer objections.Here‚Äôre 8 common objections that are holding you backüëáYour prospects don‚Äôt buy because they‚Ä¶1. Don‚Äôt understand what product you‚Äôre offering2. Don‚Äôt understand why they need to buy it/care about it3. Don‚Äôt think that this product is the best option available for them4. Don‚Äôt think that your product has a feature they‚Äôre looking for5. Don‚Äôt think that your product will fit into their workflow6. Don‚Äôt trust that your product will do what it claims to do7. Don‚Äôt want to spend time/money to migrate to your product8. Don‚Äôt think that the product is worth the moneyAnything else that I missed?#productmarketing #saas #startup

Getting messaging right for B2B SaaS products is tough.But HOW you communicate the message also matters.Here are 5 reasons why messaging fails on B2B SaaS websites üëáüö´ Website doesn‚Äôt have the content in the first place‚Ü≥ Content problemüöß It has the content, but visitors can‚Äôt find it‚Ü≥ Navigation problemüëÄ Visitors can find it, but they don‚Äôt read it‚Ü≥ Structure problem‚Ü≥ Design problem‚Ü≥ Copy problemü§Ø They read it but don‚Äôt understand it‚Ü≥ Copy clarity problem‚Ü≥ Design product mockups problemü§® They understand it, but it doesn‚Äôt resonate with them‚Ü≥ Copy relevance problem‚Ü≥ Design relevance problem#productmarketing #saas #startup

Horizontal, Vertical and Platform B2B SaaS ProductsHere‚Äôs an easy way to understand the differenceüëáHorizontal product ‚Üí single product, multiple audiencesVertical product ‚Üí multiple products, single audiencePlatform product ‚Üí multiple products, multiple audiences#productmarketing #saas #startup

Websites for Horizontal B2B SaaS Websites are expensive‚Ä¶It takes months to build out messaging for each segment.Here‚Äôre 2 ways how to launch one without breaking the bank üëá1Ô∏è‚É£ Start like a vertical product1. Define what target audience segments you have2. Pick the sweet segment in the audience (the one that gets the most value)3. Build out a persona-based page tailored to this segment4. Make this page a home page5. Build out core persona independent pages (Pricing, Book a demo)6. üöÄ Launch itKeep iterating, and once you nail it, expand to other verticals:Build out pages for other pages (Solution pages)Make the home page persona-neutral and direct traffic to relevant pages.2Ô∏è‚É£ Build a smaller version of the horizontal websiteThat‚Äôs not my favourite approach, but viable in case you absolutely can‚Äôt launch with 1 segment.1. Define what target audience segments you have2. Build a persona-agnostic home page that covers these 3 main things  ‚Üí What‚Äôs the product  ‚Üí Value prop to each segment  ‚Üí Social proof3. Build a ‚Äúproduct overview‚Äù page that covers the product in-depth4. Build out core persona independent pages (Pricing, Book a demo)üöÄ Launch itOnce launched, observe which segment resonates the most.And then, build out persona-based pages for these segments and link them back to your home page.#productmarketing #saas #startup

‚ÄúHow to increase the conversion rate of the B2B SaaS Website?‚ÄùPosition your product to be more relevant to your ideal customers.Here are 4 ways how you can do it üëá1Ô∏è‚É£ Use their languageEvery industry has its terms and jargon.Use them to feel like an insider.- Customers vs Patients- Business vs Practice- etc.2Ô∏è‚É£ Call out for whom the product isYour target audience somehow self-identify.Mention how the way they self-identify in the content like:- For whom the product is- Who‚Äôs using the product- etc.3Ô∏è‚É£ Frame benefits in a way they care aboutFigure out their KPIs, motives and what they are accountable for.And then show how your product helps to achieve them.4Ô∏è‚É£ Use relevant imagery & product mockupsProduct mockups and images you use to communicate the message too.You can make them more relevant by using the content your customers associate with.Think about a to-do list mockup with marketing tasks vs engineering tasks.Or an image of the person on the factory floor vs in the office.

Before your redesign your B2B SaaS Website,Here‚Äôs the one thing you need to know üëáüò≤Design aesthetics isn‚Äôt a silver bullet.Yes, you can leverage aesthetics and design to improve conversion.But you can only go so far before you‚Äôll see diminishing results.And that point is pretty low.If the website doesn‚Äôt convert, it doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean it isn‚Äôt pretty enough.There are other variables like:- Messaging- Traffic- Copy- OfferSo before you invest in making your website ‚Äúpop‚Äù:- Understand what problems web design solves.- Understand what‚Äôs the problem with the current website.- Do whatever is the highest impact lever for you.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Want to improve your B2B SaaS Website conversion?Look at your product demo recordings.It is a high-converting landing page in disguise üëáYour prospects have questions.And they want to answer them before they buy your B2B SaaS product.And what do great salespeople do on the product demos?Answer questions and handle objections.But you don‚Äôt necessarily need to get someone on the call to answer their questions.You can do that through the website.Look at your sales demos and note:- What questions do prospects ask- What objections do they have- How do you handle questions and objectionsUse these notes to create a website that answers those questions and objections.And you will get a salesperson that shows product demos 24/7.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Top B2B SaaS companies often add this section to their websites.Here‚Äôs why they do itüëáTo position the product to be more relevant to their ideal buyer.To stand out from the competition.To get more customers.It works because people are looking for tools built specifically for them.No one wants to do brain surgery with a kitchen knife.And likely, your prospects are already looking for a different solution because they use a generic one.Mentioning who‚Äôs your product for makes your product more relevant in the eyes of your prospects.#productmarketing #saas #startup

"We're for everyone" sounds cool.But it doesn't help your B2B SaaS website with conversion.Here's why üëáWhen your prospects visit your website, they have a question in mind:"Will it work for me?"And guess what if they think your product won't?They leave the website and never return.Because they are looking for the tool that will work in their specific case.And "for everyone" doesn't communicate well whether it will work for them.Being specific for whom your product will help you position your product as more relevant for them.And attract more customers who get the most value out of your product, which is easiest to sell to and pay the most.#productmarketing #saas #startup
Here‚Äôs How Web Design impacts B2B SaaS Website Conversion üëáIt helps you get your message through.
How top B2B SaaS position their product to be more relevant üëá#productmarketing #saas #startup

‚ÄúDoes design matter for B2B SaaS Websites?‚ÄùYes, it is.But not the way you think üëáDesign alone won‚Äôt convert visitors.Copy and messaging drive conversion.But poor design can hinder results, even of the best messaging.And great design can amplify the performance of the messaging.Website design is responsible for the following:- Comprehension of the content ‚Üí what they understand- User engagement ‚Üí how far their read- Perceived value ‚Üí what they think- Trust ‚Üí do they trustAnd the higher these are, the higher conversion you‚Äôll have.Website design matters for B2B SaaS Websites.It is the lever you can pull to increase conversion and get more customers.But it doesn‚Äôt replace the message, offer and copy.#productmarketing #saas #startup

The bigger companies your B2B SaaS targets‚Ä¶The more you need to be aware that User ‚â† Buyer.Here‚Äôs what it means for your B2B SaaS WebsiteüëáA person who is going to pay isn‚Äôt the one who will use the product.So you need to tailor your website messaging to sell to the Buyer.Likely the end users won‚Äôt even visit your website.And even if they do, they aren‚Äôt the ones who enter a credit card.Here‚Äôre a few examples:1Ô∏è‚É£¬†Invoicing software‚öôÔ∏è¬†Feature ‚Üí Multiple payment methodsüìà¬†User benefit ‚Üí Pay effortlessly‚úÖ¬†Buyer benefit ‚Üí Get payment faster2Ô∏è‚É£¬†Sales CRM‚öôÔ∏è¬†Feature ‚Üí Easy to use UIüìà¬†User benefit ‚Üí Effortlessly use the product‚úÖ¬†Buyer benefit ‚Üí Onboard team in less time3Ô∏è‚É£¬†Appointment Software‚öôÔ∏è¬†Feature ‚Üí Meeting remindersüìà¬†User benefit ‚Üí Don‚Äôt miss a meeting‚úÖ¬†Buyer benefit ‚Üí Increase show-up rateFrame the benefits of your product feature to resonate with the Buyer.Because those who will use your B2B SaaS Product aren‚Äôt the ones who‚Äôll pay for it.#productmarketing #saas #startup

‚ÄúHow to get more customers from our B2B SaaS Website?‚ÄùPosition your product to be more relevant to your customers.Here‚Äôs how to do it üëá1Ô∏è‚É£ Find your sweet target audience segmentLook at your existing customers and find the ones who:- Get the most value from the product- Brings the most money- Easiest to sell to2Ô∏è‚É£ Understand those who are going to visit the website- How do they identify themselves and their company- What language do they use- What do they care about (goals, problems, pains)- What visuals do they associate with3Ô∏è‚É£ Make the website more relevant- Call out for whom the product is in the page content- Use their terms and language in the copy- Frame benefits, problems, etc., in a way that they care about- Use visuals and images that they associate withThe more your customers feel that the product is tailored for them, the more likely they'll take action.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Your B2B SaaS product might have a self-service sign-up option.But it doesn‚Äôt mean you should use it as CTA on your website.Here‚Äôs why it can cost you revenue üëáWhen you add a ‚Äúsign up‚Äù CTA instead of ‚Äúbook a demo,‚Äù you might see:- More sign-ups- Higher conversion rates- Lower cost per leadBut will you actually see more revenue?Not always.To see the revenue, people who signed up for the trial need to become customers.And for non-paying users to become customers, they need to see:- If it will solve their problem in a first place- How will your product solve their problem- What value will your product deliver to themIf they can‚Äôt figure that out on their own, you‚Äôll be losing customers. #productmarketing #saas #startup

‚ÄúCan we do copywriting after the web design?‚ÄùNot really.Here‚Äôs why üëáCopywriting is to craft a message that will convert your visitors.Web design is to communicate the message so your visitors get it.Your message (copy) should dictate how you communicate it (design).Not the other way around.Web design without copy is just making pretty pixels.If you want to redesign your website ‚Üí start with the design.If you want to improve your website‚Äôs conversion rate ‚Üí start with copywriting. #productmarketing #saas #startup

Top B2B SaaS companies tend to have 2 CTAs on the website.One to sign up and another one to contact the sales.Here‚Äôs when it‚Äôs not a good idea üëáWhen the primary action that you want people to take is to jump on a call with you.Because ‚Äúsign-up‚Äù CTAs have way lower friction.And when given a choice, most people will choose ‚Äúsign up‚Äù over ‚Äúbook a demo.‚ÄùSo, don‚Äôt put a ‚Äúsign up‚Äù CTA on the website when your goal is to get more demos.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Design isn‚Äôt a silver bullet for B2B SaaS websites.But a tool for achieving specific goals and increasing conversion.Here‚Äôre 4 ways it can help you get more customers üëá1Ô∏è‚É£¬†Get your message throughEven the best copy won‚Äôt convert if visitors don‚Äôt read it.Design can help you get the message through by:- Capturing attention- Keeping attention- Driving attention to the key points2Ô∏è‚É£¬†Increase the perceived valueYour prospects project their first impression from the website onto your product.If your website looks modern and easy to use, they will think the same way about your product.If your website looks outdated and clunky, they will‚Ä¶ you got it.3Ô∏è‚É£¬†Explain the productProduct interface mockups are a great way to showcase your product. They make it easier to understand what‚Äôs is your product and how it works.4Ô∏è‚É£¬†Build trustA professional website builds more trust in your company.Don‚Äôt make your visitors second guess your business.  #productmarketing #saas #startup

Free trial vs. Book a demo."What should we use for our B2B SaaS Website?"Here's how to chooseüëáFree trial ‚Üí has higher conversion because of lower friction.Book a demo ‚Üí has lower conversion because of higher friction.So free trial will generate more leads for you.üôÖ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è But more leads don't mean more revenue.Either way, you'll need to sell to leads for them to become a customer:- Free trial ‚Üí through UX of the product onboarding- Book a demo ‚Üí through a demo call and the skills of the sales repsüëâ What will give you more revenue depends on where you can show the product's value with the lowest friction for a customer.So when the product has:- Intuitive UX ‚Üí "free trial" drives more revenue- Poor UX ‚Üí "book a demo" drives more revenueThere might be exceptions for enterprise deals. But that's the pattern I see for most B2B SaaS products.#productmarketing #saas #startup

If your company offers multiple B2B SaaS Products‚Ä¶Here's where you might be getting your home page wrong üëáüò≤When you're offering multiple products, the home page's goal isn't to sell.The goal is to take the visitor to the relevant page.People with different goals, problems, and objections will visit your home page when selling to different target audiences.And to convert them, you need to show how your product helps the achieve their goals and solve problems.But if you're trying to speak to everyone, you speak to no one.The home page will be either too generic.Or confuse the heck out of them.So the goal of the home page is to take them to the page of the product/solution they're looking for.Where you can tailor the messaging to resonate with their goals and needs.If you chase 2 rabbits, you won't catch either one.#productmarketing #saas #startup

‚ÄúWhy they don‚Äôt sign up for a demo?‚ÄùHere‚Äôs why your B2B SaaS Website doesn‚Äôt convert.üò≤Imagine you landed on the website of the SaaS Product you‚Äôve never heard about.Would you jump into booking a demo straight away?Probably no, because:- You don‚Äôt know what it does.- You know what it doesn't, but don‚Äôt know why you need it.- You aren‚Äôt convinced the product will deliver on its promise.- You don‚Äôt know if it integrates with your existing tools.- You don‚Äôt trust the company.- You think it is too expensive.- You don‚Äôt want to make a decision right now.- Your customers will do the same thing.If they can‚Äôt find answers to these objections, they‚Äôll leave.#productmarketing #saas #startup

‚ÄúPeople who are looking for {Product}‚ÄùThat‚Äôs not the target audience. Not the one that will help you.Here is what will help you build a high-converting SaaS websiteüëáüéØ Company- What type of business they‚Äôre in?- In what industry are they?- What‚Äôs their company size?- What‚Äôs their org structure?- Who do they sell to (B2B | B2C)?- What do they sell?- What do they get paid for?üèãÔ∏è Decision-making unit- Who initiates the search for the product?- Who tells whether the product is a good choice or not?- Who‚Äôs going to pay for the product?- Who‚Äôs going to use the product?- Who‚Äôs going to visit the website?üöß Problems & goals- What‚Äôs the problem that they‚Äôre trying to solve?- What goals they‚Äôre trying to achieve?- How do they measure success?üíº Workflow- What are their responsibilities?- What tools do they use to solve the problem?The better you understand your customers, the better offer you can make.The better your offer, the higher conversion your B2B SaaS website has.#productmarketing #saas #startup

If you get this one thing wrong about your target audience,Your B2B SaaS Website messaging will be off.Here‚Äôs what it is üëáDecision-making unit.That‚Äôs a fancy way of saying who is within the company:- Involved in the purchase decision- Going to be an end user of the productWithin the company, you can put people into the following roles:- Users ‚Üí those who are going to use the product day by day- Initiators ‚Üí those who look for a solution/identify the problem- Influencers ‚Üí the ones who tell if the product is a good choice- Buyers ‚Üí those who are going to put a credit card inIn a small business, one person can be all of them.In bigger companies, they‚Äôre all different people.Some of them will visit the website.And others will only know about your product once it is already purchased.To increase conversion of your B2B SaaS website, you need to figure out:- Who‚Äôs from the decision-making unit going to visit your website- What are their goals & problems- What are their responsibilities & KPIs- What they want to understand from your websiteAnd then tailor your website‚Äôs message to resonate with them.#productmarketing #saas #startup

If your B2B SaaS sells to multiple industries,You likely need the ‚ÄúWho is this product for‚Äù section.Here‚Äôs how to create one üëáThe main goals you want to hit with it are to:- Address the objection ‚ÄúIt won‚Äôt work for us.‚Äù- Take visitors on relevant landing pages (if you have one)3 steps to do it:1Ô∏è‚É£¬†Figure out how you can segment your target audienceHere‚Äôre a few critters that you could use:- Industry- Business model- Role/team function- Country- etc2Ô∏è‚É£¬†List all the segments by the criteria you selected3Ô∏è‚É£¬†Put it all together with copy & designHere are a few headline patterns for you:- Built for {type of the bussiness}- {Product name} helps {problem product solves} across {x} industries- Built for {type of the business} business, big or small- Built for all teams within {type of the bussiness}#productmarketing #saas #startup

Everyone agrees that you need to know your Target Audience.But how does it useful for your B2B SaaS Website?Here‚Äôs how üëáIt helps you convert more visitors into customers.Your prospects want to know how your product:- Is this product for them- Helps them achieve their goals- Helps them to solve their problems- Better than the solution they‚Äôre already usingAnd to answer these questions, you at least need to know:- Who are they- What are their goals- What problem do they have- What tools do they use to solve the problemKnowing your target audience is crucial to create a website that will convert.#productmarketing #saas #startup

"Our B2B SaaS product servers multiple industries"Creating a home page that will speak to all of them is difficult.But here is what can help you üò≤Review your customers and write down the following:- Industries they work in: Supply chain, Fashion, Software, etc.- Types of the bussiness: Retail, Wholesale, SaaS, etc.- Countries: Australia, Canada, Germany, etc.- Etc.Add a section "Who it works for" to answer a burning question üëá"Will it work for my bussiness?"It will make your website more relevant to them.And will help you address an objection on the way to conversion.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Companies in {target industry}, with a team of {team size}.That won‚Äôt help you increase your B2B SaaS website‚Äôs conversion.Here‚Äôs why ü§ØBecause behind each company, there‚Äôre people.People who:- Have a problem- Look for a solution- Visit your website- Consider your product- Make a decision to buyAnd for a B2B SaaS website to convert, it should speak to these people.Want to make the most out of the traffic you get?Figure out:- Who is within the company going to visit the website- What are their responsibilities and goals- What problem they‚Äôre trying to solve- And tailor messaging toward them.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Does your B2B SaaS serve customers from different industries?This one question can be costing your website customers.üëá‚ÄúWill it work for my bussiness?‚ÄùWhy?It is the question that your prospects have in mind when visiting your website.And If they can‚Äôt find an answer, they won‚Äôt bother to book a demo to figure that out.The more types of customers your product serve, the harder to make it relevant to them.And the more generic your homepage becomes.Working on answering that question on your website is a great opportunity to improve the conversion rate.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Your B2B SaaS Product has lots of features.But it doesn't mean you should show all of them on the home page.üò≤The more features you try to cover, the less attention you leave for showing:- What problems does your product solve- What outcomes it helps to achieve- What support you're offering- What integrations product has- What others tell about the productüò¨¬†What can you do about it?Group your features by the:- The problem they're solving- The outcome they're helping to achieve- And move the rest of them to the "product" page.ü§î¬†Why?Because SaaS products tend to have multiple features solving the same problem.And your customers only care about benefits.By grouping by the problem, you'll be able to tell the same message in much less space.And those who'd like to learn more about the feature will have the whole page.#productmarketing #saas #startup
Designing a B2B SaaS Website without nailing copy first üëá#productmarketing #saas #startup
Struggle to fit your B2B SaaS Product features on the home page?Here are 8 patterns of how top B2B SaaS companies do that üëá#productmarketing #saas #startup

Selecting images for a B2B SaaS Website can be very subjective.But here‚Äôs how we pick them for better conversion üëáüñºÔ∏èSelect visuals for the website in a way that even if visitors don‚Äôt read any copy, they will get the value prop and how it works.That‚Äôs why simplified product interface mockups usually perform better than generic illustrations or stock photos.It isn‚Äôt always easy, but that‚Äôs something to aim for if you want to increase conversion.#productmarketing #saas #startup

You cant show all features of your B2B SaaS on the home page.But you can show their value If you bundle them.Here‚Äôs how to do it üëá1Ô∏è‚É£¬†Get clear about what your customers care about:- What outcomes do they want to achieve- What problems do they want to solve- What are the jobs they need to get done2Ô∏è‚É£¬†Write all the features that your product has3Ô∏è‚É£¬†Group the list you have got by either one of these:- An outcome they deliver- A problem they solve- A job they get done4Ô∏è‚É£¬†Name each group and define what value it deliversBundles like this will let you communicate the value of your product without overwhelming the visitor.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Customers do not get the value of your B2B SaaS Product?Here‚Äôs an example of how descriptive headlines can help you üëáWhy do they work better?Because we don‚Äôt read websites.We scan websites.It means that the only thing most of your visitors will read are headlines.So make sure they get the point if that‚Äôs the only thing they read.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Your B2B SaaS Product may have 10s or 100s of features.How can you explain all of them to your website visitors?üëáUse feature bundles.You are unlikely to communicate the value of every single feature on a single page.But you can bundle features together based on:- Outcome/benefits that they delivery- A problem that they solve- A job that they get doneAnd then communicate the outcome/problem/job of the whole bundle.Yes, you might not show every feature.But your visitors care more about outcomes anyway.#productmarketing #saas #startup

"How to present 2 different products on one B2B SaaS Website?"Here's the navigation pattern top B2B SaaS Companies use üëáThey don't try to communicate everything on a single page.Since the more you try to communicate on the page, the fewer visitors will get it.Instead, they create for each product a standalone:- Landing page- Navigation & pricing#productmarketing #saas #startup

‚ÄúYou need to communicate value vs. features.‚ÄùHave you struggled with this on your B2B SaaS website?Here‚Äôs why üëáBecause B2B SaaS Products can have 10s or 100s of features.And it is hard enough to keep all of them in mind.To communicate the value of the feature, you first need to know what the feature is.That‚Äôs why creating a list of them is a good idea.First, get clarity on what solutions your product has.And then figure out what value they deliver.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Website holding you back your marketing campaigns?Here's how to ship B2B SaaS Website updates on autopilot.üëáWhy do internal website projects drag on so often?Because people who are responsible for them:- Don't have time- Don't have relevant skillsProduct designers are busy designing products.Developers are busy building the product.CMO is busy building out the marketing team.They can all build a website, but none is exactly an expert in that.And they have enough on their plates.üëâ¬†Having people responsible only for the website will help.Here's the team that can ship you any website project:Copywriter -> messaging, structure, copyWeb Designer -> layout, structure, visual designGraphic Designer -> icons, illustrations, aestheticsMotion Designer -> engaging animationsWeb Developer -> building out the designPM/Art Director -> coordinates the workYou won't need everyone full-time.And not a specialist for each. Often one person can wear many hats.But you'll need a team that has both the skills & time to improve your website.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Does Your website not reflect the true value of your B2B SaaS?Here are 2 things that could go wrong:üëá- You either communicate a wrong message- Or you communicate the right message the wrong wayCommunicating the right message comes down to knowing:- Who are your target audience is- What problem you're solving- How is your product different from alternatives- What's the value of your productAnd you communicate the message through:- Copywriting- Website Design- Motion Design- Graphic DesignIf either message or how you communicate it is off, your prospects won't get you.#productmarketing #saas #startup
Here's where an opportunity to improve your B2B SaaS website üëá#productmarketing #saas #startup

If you need to build a B2B SaaS Websiteüëâ Hire Web MasterIf you need to build a B2B SaaS Website that converts, hire üëá- Copywriter- Web Designer- Web Developer- Motion Designer- Graphic DesignerBuilding any website involves skills across many domains.But it is very unlikely for one person to poses all the skills.Some folks are great in several domains.But not in all domains.And they are pretty rare.To take a website from good to great, you'll need to push every domain as high as you can.#productmarketing #saas #startup
How top B2B SaaS companies present features on their websites üëáFeature (What). Value (Why). Explainer (How). + Product mockup.#productmarketing #saas #startup
When you start B2B SaaS Website revamp by selecting a color#productmarketing #saas #startup

Your B2B SaaS Website Revamp will go southIf you start it from these steps üëáü§Ø- Defining visual style for a hero section- Selecting website references- Selecting a color palate & fontsThere is nothing wrong with that.It is a crucial part of the visual design process for the website.But these steps are just the finishing steps of the process.The biggest levers you can pull to increase conversion lay in the foundation.- Strategy- Positioning & value prop- Website & page structure- CopyVisual design without a strong foundation is like fixing cracks in the wall with paint.#productmarketing #saas #startup

B2B SaaS website doesn‚Äôt convert?Here‚Äôs a 5-stage roadmap for a SaaS Website Revamp üëáüõ£Ô∏è¬†Strategy/Audit- Understand what problem-solving- Define what goals you want to achieve- Figure out how to solve a problem/achieve a goal- Define how you‚Äôll measure the result- Define the scope of worküì¶¬†Product discovery/positioningGet clear about:- Who is the target audience- What are the goals & problems of the TA- How does your product solve the problem- Why people will choose your product over alternative‚úíÔ∏è¬†Copywriting- Create a structure for each page- Write high converting copy for pages- Write copy for meta tags & open graphüç´¬†Web design- Black and white wireframes for desktop- Visual design for the desktop- Design of the product interface mockups- Mobile version designü§Ω‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è¬†Web development- Develop desktop & mobile version- Implement animations- Integrate 3d party tools- Set up analytics- Connect Domain#productmarketing #saas #startup
Just a quick reminder.Revamping your B2B SaaS Website:- Won‚Äôt fix a lack of traffic- Won‚Äôt fix a poor product- Won‚Äôt fix the sales process#productmarketing #saas #startup

B2B SaaS Websites are getting more and more sophisticated.Here‚Äôs a frequent website pages among top SaaS companies.üëá- Home (Main landing page)- Pricing & Plans (How much it costs)- Features/sub-products (Landing page for each feature)- Use cases/Solutions (How you can use a product)- Industries/audience (Who can use the product)- Integrations (How you can use it within your workflow)- Resources (Blog, eBooks, templates, free tools, etc.)- About us (Promote employer brand and attract talent)- Comparison (Your product vs Alternative)- Case studies/Customer stories- CareersUse it for inspiration when planning your B2B SaaS website.But adjust what is best in your situation.Every product is different.#productmarketing #saas #startup

Building a B2B SaaS Website involves a lot of roles.And how to get everyone on the same page?Here are 2 things to include in a website brief üëáü§å Product vision- What is the product?- Who is the target audience?- What goals & problems do they have?- How product solves those problems?- How is it better than alternatives?üõÄ Project overview- What is the project?- What are the outcomes we are trying to achieve?- How do we plan to achieve it?- What are the constraints we have?- It will ensure that everyone understands what business outcomes you want to achieve.- And have a context about the product to deliver those outcomes.#productmarketing #saas #startup

There is no one-size-fits-all layout for the B2B SaaS Homepage.But there are best practices that seem to work.Here‚Äôs a pattern that top B2B SaaS companies use üëáü¶∏ Hero- Value proposition- Explainer what is the product- Product mock-up that shows it in action- Primary CTA- Secondary CTA with lower friction- Risk Reversal (cancel any time, try for free, no card required, etc.)üë£ Social proof- Logos of the Clients/Partners/Integrations- Customer reviews- Widgets of 3d party review services‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π Explain the problem- Visual representation of the problem- The problem that the product solves‚öôÔ∏è Solution- A high-level overview of the solution- How it worksüî¨ Highlight specific features- Pre header with the name of the feature- Value of the feature- Explainer how it delivers the value- Product mock-ups that show the feature in actionüí´ Reinforce a unique benefit of the product- Why they can‚Äôt fix problems themselves- How is it better than competitors/alternativesüéØ Final CTA- Value prop of the product- Primary CTA button#productmarketing #saas #startup

For many years, I struggled with conflict.I used to go out of my way to avoid it (anyone relate?), but I learned early on that addressing conflict is important, even if it feels uncomfortable. And what helps is having an understanding the psychology of conflict and how to improve the chances of a more positive outcome. One of the earliest lessons I discovered was the power of where you sit and the physical positioning - it‚Äôs called proxemics. Instead of sitting opposite someone (or as far away as possible), try sitting side-by-side. It takes you from feeling like opponents to being on the same team, both focused on tackling the problem together. So, remember this: Change your seat, Change the game. üí™How comfortable are you when it comes to navigating conflict? And what are your best tips for how to navigate conflict situations? I‚Äôd love to hear from you! üëá#conflict #conflictresolution

Are you an entry-level CTO or Head of Tech? Have you ever felt that your years of industry experience were overshadowed by individuals with fancy degrees and certifications? I believe it's time to challenge this perception and recognize the immense potential that young leaders bring to the table.The problem often faced by emerging leaders is the assumption that experience at the top level is a prerequisite for success. While experience is undoubtedly valuable, it should not be the sole criterion for evaluating leadership potential. Hard work, talent, and the ability to adapt should be given due consideration.One of the greatest advantages of hiring young leaders is their innate adaptability. In an ever-evolving landscape driven by technologies like web3 and AI, the ability to quickly learn and embrace new ideas is a game-changer. Young leaders bring fresh perspectives, innovative thinking, and the drive to revolutionize industries at a rapid pace.Contrary to popular belief, a fancy degree or certification does not guarantee superior leadership capabilities. Experience gained through years of working from the ground up is invaluable, offering insights and a deep understanding of the industry. Young leaders possess the unique advantage of being in touch with the latest trends, technologies, and emerging markets. They are primed to seize opportunities and drive innovation.We must recognize the value of diverse perspectives and open ourselves to the possibility that young leaders can excel in leadership roles. Organizations that prioritize a balance between experience and qualifications, while embracing new ideas, stand to benefit greatly. It's not about disregarding the accomplishments of seasoned professionals, but rather acknowledging that young leaders can bring a transformative energy to propel organizations forward.Let's encourage a culture that values hard work, talent, and adaptability over traditional markers of success. By providing opportunities, mentorship, and support, we can empower young leaders to make a lasting impact and drive innovation in the ever-evolving tech landscape.#Leadership #Innovation #YoungLeaders #Adaptability #FreshPerspectives

‚öôÔ∏èüöÄ DevOps Best Practices: CI/CD for Faster Time to MarketDevOps has become a critical part of modern software development, helping teams to collaborate more effectively and deliver software faster and more reliably. One of the key components of DevOps is continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD), which enables teams to automate the process of building, testing, and deploying software. In this article, we will explore some of the best practices for CI/CD and how they can help to speed up time to market. ‚öôÔ∏èüöÄWhat is DevOps? ü§îDevOps is a software development methodology that emphasizes collaboration and communication between development and operations teams. It is designed to help teams deliver software faster and more reliably, by breaking down silos and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.CI/CD for Faster Time to Market üöÄ‚è∞CI/CD is a key component of DevOps, and enables teams to automate the process of building, testing, and deploying software. By automating these processes, teams can reduce the time and effort required to release new software, while also improving quality and reducing errors. Here are some best practices for CI/CD:Automate Everything: To get the most out of CI/CD, it's important to automate as much as possible, including building, testing, and deploying software.Test Early and Often: Testing is a critical part of the software development process, and should be integrated into the CI/CD pipeline. By testing early and often, teams can catch errors before they become more difficult and expensive to fix.Use the Right Tools: There are a wide range of tools available for CI/CD, and it's important to choose the right ones for your team and your workflow.Monitor Performance: Continuous monitoring of performance is important for ensuring that software is performing as expected and identifying issues before they become critical.Encourage Collaboration: Collaboration between development and operations teams is critical for the success of CI/CD. Encouraging open communication and sharing of knowledge can help to break down silos and improve team performance.Overall, CI/CD is a powerful tool for speeding up time to market and improving the quality of software. By following best practices and integrating CI/CD into your workflow, you can streamline the software development process and deliver software faster and more reliably. ‚öôÔ∏èüöÄConclusion ü§ùDevOps and CI/CD are critical components of modern software development, enabling teams to collaborate more effectively and deliver software faster and more reliably. By following best practices and automating as much as possible, teams can streamline the software development process and reduce time to market. As more companies adopt DevOps and CI/CD, we are likely to see even greater improvements in software quality and delivery times. üåüüíª#DevOps #CI/CD #SoftwareDevelopment #Automation #Testing #Monitoring #Collaboration #ContinuousImprovement

The field of interior design is experiencing rapid changes, driven by advancements in technology, evolving design trends, and shifting consumer expectations. What do you think? Sustainable and Eco-Friendly Design: With increasing awareness of environmental issues, there is a growing demand for sustainable and eco-friendly interior design. Designers are incorporating sustainable materials, energy-efficient technologies, and environmentally conscious practices into their designs. This includes using recycled or upcycled materials, implementing smart energy systems, and focusing on energy-efficient lighting and appliances.Technology Integration: Technology is transforming the way we interact with our living spaces. Smart home systems and the Internet of Things (IoT) are becoming more prevalent, allowing homeowners to control various aspects of their interiors through connected devices. Interior design is incorporating technology seamlessly, with features like automated lighting, temperature control, and voice-activated assistants integrated into the design process.Virtual and Augmented Reality: Virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) technologies are revolutionizing the interior design process. Designers can create virtual environments that allow clients to visualize and experience their designs before implementation. VR and AR also enable customization and personalization of spaces, where clients can see different furniture, finishes, and layouts in real-time, facilitating better decision-making.Biophilic Design: Biophilic design emphasizes the integration of nature and natural elements into indoor spaces. It recognizes the positive impact of nature on well-being and incorporates features such as indoor plants, natural light, green walls, and natural materials. Biophilic design seeks to create harmonious and calming environments that enhance occupant health and productivity.Flexible and Multifunctional Spaces: As the way we live and work continues to evolve, interior design is adapting to create flexible and multifunctional spaces. Designers are incorporating modular furniture, movable walls, and adaptable layouts that can easily transform to accommodate changing needs. This flexibility allows spaces to be utilized efficiently and maximizes their functionality.Personalization and Customization: Consumers are seeking personalized and unique interior design solutions. With advancements in manufacturing techniques like 3D printing and customization software, designers can create customized furniture, fixtures, and decor items tailored to individual preferences. This personalization trend extends to color schemes, textures, and finishes, allowing clients to create spaces that reflect their personalities and lifestyle.#technology #experience #design #work #innovation via @ civilengineeriing¬†#sustainability

ùóîùó¥ùóøùó∂ùó∞ùòÇùóπùòÅùòÇùóøùóÆùóπ ùòÅùó≤ùó∞ùóµùóªùóºùóπùóºùó¥ùòÜ or #agrotechnology is the use of technology in agriculture, horticulture, and aquaculture with the aim of improving yield, efficiency, and profitability.Modern farms and agricultural operations work far differently than those a few decades ago, primarily because of advancements in #technology, including sensors, devices, machines, and information technology.Today‚Äôs agriculture routinely uses sophisticated technologies such as robots, temperature and moisture sensors, aerial images, and GPS technology.üå±Some examples of agriculture technology include:1. Precision Farming: This involves the use of advanced technology such as GPS and remote sensing to improve crop yields and reduce waste. It includes techniques such as soil mapping, crop mapping, and yield monitoring.2. Drones: Drones can be used to survey and map fields, monitor crops, and deliver inputs such as pesticides and fertilizers.3. Sensors: Sensors can be used to monitor soil moisture, temperature, and nutrient levels, which can help farmers make better decisions about planting, irrigation, and fertilizer application.4. Artificial Intelligence: AI can be used to analyze data collected from sensors, drones, and other sources to help farmers make better decisions about planting, harvesting, and marketing their crops.5. Vertical Farming: This involves growing crops in vertically stacked layers, using artificial lighting and hydroponic systems. Freedom is not free.A year ago, when the first explosion shattered our cities, we took new social roles we never asked for. We became warriors. Survivors. Defenders. Fundraisers. Ambassadors for our country.Our lives will never be the same.The war changed us, Ukrainians. The fragility of every moment and life itself crystallized our values, priorities, principles, and choices.We never asked for this crash test, but every day since has challenged our dignity, unity, bravery, endurance, and determination.Personally, I could never imagine all that we have gone through.Living through historical events is tough, but Ukrainians are making history in the truest sense.With our hard-earned chance to build a thriving country and shift geopolitical vectors, we continue to defend not only our country but the values which hold the world.Many tragedies and challenges were brought to our land, but our determination and devotion to independence and a better future remain unwavering.And for that, I want to say thank you to all fellow Ukrainians.And to all those who support us worldwide.Keep breaking through the darkness, being the light.It always prevails. üá∫üá¶ ‚úä
